WrittenText_BookstandSQ50_2: Intriguing. According to my research, growing fire root on soil mixed with grated fire lizard tongues not only significantly increases their magical properties, but also has some interesting side effects. Time for a little reorganization of my garden!
WrittenText_BookstandSQ50_4: So far, the side effects are causing more trouble than I anticipated. While I'm sure I'll find some ingenious use for them in the future, at the moment they're making it difficult for me to prepare a pure decoction from my improved fire roots. Once I'm done with the potion, I need to come up with some good name for my wonderful plant...
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_1: Alchemy is divided into 3 levels. While the first one could be learned from books, a good teacher will be needed for the next ones. Each of the levels allows you to produce more powerful potions:
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_2: -Beginner - simple healing decoctions, blue elder extracts and short-lasting speed potions.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_3: -Advanced - basic and advanced healing decoctions, potions temporarily enhancing the abilities and long-lasting speed potions.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_4: -Master - powerful healing decoctions and potions permanently enhancing abilities.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_5: Along with learning the next levels, master passes on the knowledge of healing potions, but acquiring more complex recipes is up to the apprentice.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_6: An experienced alchemist can also extract plant seeds from the game he has hunted and convert them into healing potions. However, no temporary or permanent potion has yet been produced through the seeds.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Alchemy_7: Although permanent potions seem to be the most powerful, don't forget about temporary potions - they come from different ingredients, so they don't use up the alchemist's precious resources, and their effects are really powerful!
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_1: First, to use a bow, the hunter should develop his dexterity, while to wield a crossbow, strength will be required.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_2: Despite the difference in predispositions required to wield these weapons, each marksman can increase the damage dealt by his weapon by developing his dexterity. Dexterity is what influences the complex process of preparing the projectiles for firing and how much damage they will do in the end.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_3: However, this should not be confused with shooting skills - the skill with a bow or crossbow will primarily determine the accuracy and speed of the shots. A master will fire many more projectiles at a time, while hitting targets much farther away from himself.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_4: Why crossbows are so popular? You should pay attention to the base power of the projectile fired from a crossbow. It is much greater than that of a bow. Due to the construction of the bolt and the speed at which it moves, it is extremely effective against heavily armored opponents.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_5: An often overlooked advantage of crossbows is their ability for a balanced development - a good crossbowman is someone who is strong enough to wield massive crossbows, but also skillful enough to inflict a lot of damage with them.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Bow_6: Both bows and crossbows, even in the hands of novice marksmen, are capable of knocking a man down without killing him on the spot. However, if you need to make sure your enemy doesn't get up, you should carry even the simplest of melee weapons.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_1: Until I began to explore the wonderful art of cooking, all the ingredients I encountered seemed completely unnecessary. I was unknowingly missing a great opportunity to try many wonderful dishes!
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_2: You won't cook anything tasty without the right recipe. You can usually find them written down on paper. Buy all the ones you can find and read them right away. Unlike complicated alchemy, cooking requires no extra training!
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_3: You'll need the right place - a pan over the fire, a skewer, a big pot, or a home stove - anything will do. You can even cook several batches at once to save a lot of time.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_4: Some recipes may call for a bit of more expensive ingredients, such as vinegar, salt or cinnamon. Fear not, such trace amounts are used for a single dish that they will easily last you for many months.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_5: Not only will prepared meals allow you to recover much faster than eating individual ingredients, but enjoying a variety of dishes will improve your overall health!
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_6: Moreover, ingredients like apples and raspberries don't lose their additional properties, even after preparation.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Cooking_7: Now that you know everything, you can get down to cooking with confidence!
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_1: Regardless of what you are fighting with, no weapon available for purchase can compare to the convenience of using a handcrafted weapon.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_2: Because they are made perfectly to one's body proportions, they almost always require the user to have less strength or dexterity to wield them effectively.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_3: In order to begin crafting your own weapons, you must first decide whether you want to pursue bowmaking, which involves the crafting of both bows and crossbows, or perhaps practice blacksmithing, which specializes in all things related to melee weapons. Once you've decided, find the right teacher - no book can replace practice under the guidance of an experienced master.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_4: Learning can be divided into three stages - beginner, advanced and master. With each one, craftsman can master more complex diagrams and craft them on the bowyer's table or anvil respectively.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_5: Recipes can usually be purchased from other blacksmiths and bowyers. Most weapons require various hunting trophies, such as skins, fangs or claws of specific beasts. To reduce costs, it is a good idea to develop hunting skills yourself.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Craft_6: To produce ranged weapons, you will always need proper wood, bowstrings and, for the finer works, lizard tongues. Basic melee weapons require pure iron, while steel and magic ore one's will also need coal and magic ore nuggets respectively.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Bat_2: The inhabitants of towns and villages alike often tell tales of mysterious creatures from the depths of sewers or abandoned caves. Fear is a powerful thing, so the local populace likes to spin unbelievable tales of demons that feed on the blood of the innocent. The truth is quite different. Some caves and unvisited parts of city sewers are inhabited by bats.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Bat_3: These oversized nocturnal creatures can fly, and since they are equipped with fangs and claws, they don't hesitate to use them against their prey. In fact, it's best not to wake them at all, as they sleep for days. A skilled hunter will simply sneak past them. In the event of a clash, these creatures are particularly vulnerable to projectiles. A skilled mage can also knock them down with a gust of wind'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Bear_1: Bears, despite appearances, could be written about at great length. As dangerous as they are, they are also easy to avoid or even kill, depending on your hunting skills. Bears are obviously huge and very strong. They inhabit forests and small caves. Many scholars have wondered if the bear is somehow related to the dogs and wolves we all know, but this theory has largely collapsed for lack of meaningful evidence.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Bear_2: There is, however, a belief among friends in academia that a breakthrough in the unraveling of the creature's origins is yet to come. Scientific and naturalistic meanderings aside, the bear, despite its strength, is vulnerable to sword or axe blows. In case of an encounter, the best solution is to skillfully dodge the animal's slow attacks and quickly counterattack with a series of slashes'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_BeginningAndE: In the first hour we thank you for life,
On the bright day we praise your word,
In the black night we make requests to Thee,
With our last breath we commend our soul to Thee,
Thou art the beginning and the end. The first and the last.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_CircleOfLife_: Ezran unrolled the parchment and began mumbling. He touched the dead plant and focused very hard. He felt it coming back to life briefly, its leaves gently rippling in the wind. But as soon as the boy opened his eyes, the blue glow in his hands disappeared, and the plant subsided.

Master Larius watched Ezran from a distance. His determination impressed him greatly, but it also brought him concern. Larius approached Ezran and embraced him as a caring father would embrace his son.

They left the monastery and headed west through a dense grove. Larius showed Ezran the beauty of nature. He showed him the clumps of river myrtle and the violets growing in the groves. He showed him how a little molerat took its first steps, only to become food for the she-wolf and her cubs.

Thus, Ezran understood what the Circle of Life was. He took the plant out of the bundle. It was almost all withered except for one fruit, which still resisted the inevitable. He picked the fruit and buried it gently in the ground. A moment later, he felt the first drop of spring rain on his forehead and smiled slightly.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_CityOnFire_01: The worst of it all was the stench. I remember it to this day. It wasn't the usual stench of rotten fish in the market or tanned hides, but the nostril-piercing, lingering stench of charred human flesh. I could smell it in the streets, in the houses, even on the steps of the church.
In a few moments, the fire started by the Southerners had engulfed almost the entire harbour and begun to seep into the Artisans’ District.
And when it had consumed all the crates and barrels, it broke into the barracks. Guards and volunteers fought bravely, but they were too few to stop the raging flames from spreading.

And then, when for a moment the wind blew away the flames already reaching the Old Town, I saw him standing on the battlements. I saw Mandes. A murderer with the dying city at his feet. In a daring gesture of victory, he held his torch high and admired his work of destruction. By Innos, if I carried the crossbow, that monster would have gotten what he deserved.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_CityOnFire_02: They say that true friends are made in need. While it wasn't that long ago that I was looking for a reason to bust that shithead Adelard and his ragged band, today they stood shoulder to shoulder with us. After long hours of fighting the elements, together we managed to put out the flames and the Southerners were either killed or captured. Their leader, however, vanished without a trace.
Some claimed to have seen Mandes throw himself into the flames to escape  the inevitable noose.

Others argued that they had brought him justice themselves, but had 'forgotten' where they had left the body. Then there were those who brought me random Southerners, demanding carts filled to the brim with gold for them.

Whatever the fate of Mandes, his words, like the poison of a bloodfly, had become deeply embedded in the blood of his people. As my men led the captured Southerners to the scaffold, I saw in their eyes neither fear nor regret, but anger - pure, fiery anger. I do not know where, when or how, but sooner or later these barbarians will take up arms again, and this time we must be ready for it.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crab_1: Among the nobility, interest in maritime culture has been flourishing for some time. Rich gentlemen and their ladies spend their leisure time on the beaches. However, habits brought from the cities are the cause of numerous mishaps and accidents. The best example is a close encounter with crabs. These oversized arthropods are covered with a thick shell. They are territorial.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crab_2: They do not like to be disturbed. This is especially true for individuals during the mating season. A cooperating male crab is very aggressive. Not knowing what they are doing, citizens of cities approach busy crustaceans, after which they end up with broken arms, legs and numerous bruises. Either way, in the event of a close encounter with a crab, a blow with a club or a stream of magic is enough to kill them'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crossbows_1: The man stepped out of the tent and stretched his legs. Feeling a breeze of fresh air, he hurriedly wrapped himself in his fur and took a sip of wine. He approached the pond and shaved his beard properly. After all, he had been a lieutenant since yesterday. The trenches were ready.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crossbows_2: The boy was shivering from the cold. He hadn't hoped for much since the invaders' victory. After all, he was on the 'bad' side. But he had not expected in his worst dreams that he would be sitting in cold and starving for a week.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crossbows_3: The night before, they had dug a moat around the camp, but forgot to fill it with water.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crossbows_4: The man walked slowly across the frozen grass. A few shouts from afar disturbed his peace. He picked up his crossbow. Ten steps. He put the weapon to his face and pulled the trigger.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Crossbows_5: The boy felt something pierce his chest. Something cold and hard. He didn't even have a moment to think about what it was, from where, and for what. But he was glad that it was over. He fell into the trench dug below and ceased to feel anything at all.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_1: Many people believe that dragons belong only to the world of bedtime stories told to naughty children. But are these winged beasts really nothing more than the product of human imagination? There is some evidence to cast doubt on this claim.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_2: Amongst the dusty books piling up in the library at Waldfried, I found a yellowed manuscript from the era of Rhobar I, a wanted notice for the 'great lizard ravaging the western reaches of the land'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_3: Merchants I met along the Scarlet Road in Middle Varrant claimed that on one of the stalls in Saffron Oasis,
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_4: the key trade post in the region, they saw something that resembled giant reptile scales.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_5: During my journey home, I spoke with a peculiar man who introduced himself to me as the last surviving member of a certain knightly brotherhood. He argued that his companions were killed by a red dragon.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Dragons_6: I shall leave it to you to decide whether these great monsters truly existed. I wish to believe that each of these stories has a grain of truth in it, and these terrifying, yet majestic, reptiles still slumber in the deepest recesses and cross the skies of our world.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_ErrorsWaterMa: Catalog of Errors of the Followers of Adanos
Followers of Adanos live in the belief that they are the keepers of order. Maybe they are, maybe they are not. Who can know enough to judge divine matters?
Although the gates of divine knowledge are forever barred from us, we can at least have something to say about our own fate.
The most serious of the charges against followers of Adanos is their insane, almost dogmatic love of order.

Based on the pure speculations, they postulate the existence of some mysterious laws governing the world. And on this basis, they conclude that sometimes they must indirectly serve Beliar, and sometimes Innos.
For many, this is unacceptable. What is the difference between a villager slaughtered by orcs and a villager gifted by paladins?
The world is already uneven enough for a man, even a mage of great rank, to apply this equally unfair and unwise judgment.
Catalog of Errors of the Followers of Adanos
The Water Mages seem to hold the view that the eternal balance between Beliar and Innos is best.
But who says it has to be this way? A sage from a few thousand years ago? What does a mage who lived eras before know about our times? Nothing!
Key issues of our societies should be solved with contemporary and therefore adequate remedies. Not philosophical fables described in vague terms.
We have now come to the final issue to be addressed in this series of arguments. How do the followers of Adanos want to teach their knowledge? Well, not at all!
Although people do listen to them, probably out of pity and desire for entertainment, their speeches mean nothing - and they do nothing about it!

Simple people endowed with their philosophy will misinterpret it, make mistakes, and do evil. Already we see people treat each other terribly, calling upon vague dogmas of the so-called law and balance.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Fire_1: Thou dispels the darkness of Morgrad with a sword of light!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Fire_2: Thou guards the Palace of Power with a shield of fire!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Fire_3: Thou lightest the stars at night for travellers!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Fire_4: Thou rewards the righteous and punish the fallen!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Fire_5: Thou art the Eternal Light, never to be extinguished!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_FireLizzard_2: The fire lizard is a phenomenon in the natural world. At first, some assumed that these creatures were some strange heirs to dragons. However, this is impossible to confirm in any way, due to the apparent lack of irrefutable evidence for the existence of these large winged reptiles.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_FireLizzard_3: Currently, the genesis of fire lizards is thought to be changes resulting from an ordinary lizard's exposure to harsh environmental conditions. The fire lizard has simply developed an additional line of defense.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_FireLizzard_4: Although these bests are fond of volcanoes, due to the extinction of the one on Archolos, most of them can be found on beaches and arid areas. It is not know, however, how to extract a substance that causes the 'fire breathing'. Nonetheless, an extreme caution is advised when confronting them. The best way to keep fire lizards at bay is to finish them off with a scroll of the wind fist.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Frogman_1: Like many other nonhuman humanoid creatures, frogmen are of particular interest to us. Research on these intelligent beasts has been going on for some time. They are usually found around forest streams. They usually live in groups of several individuals, though they are also found alone. Unlike goblins, frogmen are taller than humans.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Frogman_2: They resemble somewhat shrunken, amphibian-like orcs rather than the hated by all goblins. Interestingly, frogmen are not limited to simple weapons such as maces. More and more often you can come across individuals using small pebble slingshots. While even a strong blow can be blocked, a stone shot from a slingshot is not so easy to see, let alone reflect. Ultimately, however, despite their strength and size, frogmen are not sturdy creatures, and a good hit with a sword or axe can take them down'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Light_1: Before the stars hung in the sky, and the mountains and the seas rose from the vast abysses of the world, an infinite darkness reigned over all existence, and its master was Beliar, the Deceiver and the Wicked One. For a thousand years the Cursed One ruled Morgrad, the world and the heavens, offering endless gifts to mankind. Blinded by lust for riches, one by one they fell into the snare of the Liar, becoming his slaves.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Light_2: But the lamentations of man reached the ears of Innos, who with his luminous sword cut the ribbon of the Eternal Void and dispelled the darkness. The burning brightness of his blade melted the darkest hearts, and brought straying men back to the path of light. But then the Dark One summoned the Beast to the world, who poisoned people's hearts again and darkness hung over the sky. But the Lord of Light did not leave man in his hour of need and he raised above the clouds a shield of light, which to this day brings hope to the afflicted.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_LondramBow_1: Although the bow as a weapon and a hunting tool has been around since the dawn of time, its heyday was during the reign of Volfzack, the first ruler of Archolos. Made famous on Londram, one of the islands of the Eastern Archipelago, the long bow, later known as the 'Londram bow', took a heavy toll on the light-armed warriors of the 'Wolf'. The initial success of Volfzack's campaign was met with heavy losses, and the ruler was ultimately forced to leave empty handed.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_LondramBow_2: This lesson, though difficult to swallow, undoubtedly gave Volfzack food for thought. Seeing with his own eyes hundreds of his men drop dead under a hail of arrows,
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_LondramBow_3: the ruler of Archolos, after his campaign on Londram, tried to form regular archer units himself. However, the effect of these actions was far from what was intended due to the low level of training of the archers.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_LondramBow_4: There are many stories about the Londramians. They are said to be unrivalled in the use of the bow, because they begin training their arm muscles at an early age. Others, a little out of spite, a little out of jealousy, say that the islanders are so attached to their bows that they sleep with them more often than with their wives. Whether you believe these stories or not, the truth is that you won't find better shooters anywhere in the world than Londramians
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_1: A guard is a shield to the citizens and a sword to its enemies, a guarantor of the Law. However, the title and equipment alone do not make him the authority. It's the four principles by which guards must always live.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_3: Although a guard does not shed blood on the frontlines, his role in the city is no less important. Serving the Kingdom is his main goal.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_5: Many temptations lie in wait, but one who is mindful of the good of the city and citizens, tirelessly follows the path of law.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_7: The enemy does not always rush into battle with open visor, but remains in hiding, often taking the form of false friends. The guard must not be taken by surprise.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_9: The uniform is a second skin to the guard, and a well-maintained uniform is a sign of respect for the letter of the law.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Militia_10: Now you are ready, boys. Put on your armor and gird your swords. Say your prayers and move out. The city needs you!'
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_NerdsKitchen_: Legends tell of a recipe for a dish so perfect that after eating it, one may not eat it for months. A meal that does not cause any unwanted side effects, and on the contrary, keeps the eater in perfect physical and spiritual condition. With this dish, we could forever get rid of hunger and all the diseases associated with an inadequate diet.

I had to sell my inn to continue my research. With the gold I collected, I bought every possible spice and ingredient I knew and boarded a ship to the capital of culinary excesses, the island of Archolos.

My experiments lasted for years. During that time I created many delicious recipes that spoiled the palates of even the most picky eaters. Unfortunately, every time I thought I was one step away from the perfect recipe, new complications arose. I do so with sadness, but I must abandon further attempts to discover this recipe. I have spent enough time in my workshop. It is time to go out into the world and share what I have accomplished so far. Who knows, maybe this legendary dish is just a fairy tale, or maybe one day there will be a cook who will try to make Nehctik Sdren - as this legendary dish was called.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Shadowbeast_1: Some creatures have legends that are laughable at best. There are, however, some that even the most distinguished hunters are afraid of. With the shadowbeast - because we are talking about it here - our research group met only once and it was truly amazing. The black beast resembling a cross between a puma and a bear tore to pieces three guards who escorted us. We were leading an expedition deep into the forest to study the local flora for useful herbalists.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Shadowbeast_2: The expedition was not only a tragedy that resulted in the death of three people. The shadow fell also on the surrounding village, because, as it turned out later, our dubious travels scared the creature out of the cave. Enraged, it began to feed on the pigs of the villagers. The beast was only killed by a group of several knights and mages. In any case, do not wander at night through dense forests and dark caves, which are often chosen by Shadowbeasts as their lair.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Sun_1: Imagine an unstoppable wall of fire, engulfing house after house, street after street. Imagine the desperate screams of men and women dying in the thickening flames. Imagine our joy when the unshakeable bastion of tyranny and degradation began to crumble before our eyes. After all, what are all these sacrifices in the face of the change Mandes offered us?
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Sun_2: Since the death of Lord Dominique in the Southern Islands, the Myrtanians began to take everything we had - rights, possessions, freedom.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Sun_3: Eventually, our lives as well. Locked up in a dungeon for false offenses, sentenced to years of backbreaking labor in the Valley of Mines, we responded with full and necessary force.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Sun_4: Some say that our leader was the son of a wealthy satrap from Zandir Sol, who by his hands wanted to cause another war with Myrtana. Others claimed that he sought revenge on the governor for having murdered his entire family. But who really was Mandes? We don't know. To me he was an idea. The idea of fighting for what is right. An ordinary, common man like you and me. The one who achieved the impossible. The ardent sun that awakened the hearts of the South.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Swamp_2: I knew that disgusting sword had to be the key! What an amazing feeling, to find myself in a place untouched by any human for maybe even thousands of years! I don't have time to write, I must explore!
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Swamp_4: Good thing I took some basic fieldwork equipment and plenty of food with me, this place is even more exciting than I thought...
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Swamp_6: I think I'm starting to understand some of the mysterious signs and symbols used by the original inhabitants
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Swamp_7: The door to the right of the entrance is signed more or less as 'healthy life of prosperity', while the one on the other side as 'peace and poverty of the sage'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Swamp_9: Maybe it's just my head, but I've been hearing some stone noises... Opening the gate may have disturbed the structure of the ceiling. I hope this doesn't hinder examination of the main room opposite the altar. That large circle on the pedestal is impressive, I wonder if it had any role. I'll get to it tomorrow.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Troll_1: The variation of specimens in size is a very characteristic feature of temperate climates. One of the more momentous instances of the magnificence of life in our world is the troll. It is a gigantic creature that surpasses many a human building, covered with thick and tough fur. Equipped by nature with powerful arms and long fangs, the troll presents a great danger to travelers and adventurers who roam the wilderness of mountain ranges and basins.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Troll_2: It is impossible to penetrate their thick skin with any projectile. A creature so massive can hardly be expected to fall. However, a Troll can be tricked quite easily. Due to its size, the creature is slow, which is something to take advantage of in a fight. The impact of troll's blows can throw a person into the air, so it is a good idea to take a fall-mitigating potion if possible'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Turtle_1: While traversing a swampy area with our research group, we came across some very territorial creatures, which we later named mudturtles. They resemble a much overgrown reptile the size of a molerat, and one covered with a shell. They are slow and seem quite stupid.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Turtle_2: But don't let this fool anyone. Their exceptional stubbornness, combined with their thick shell and razor-sharp teeth, make them extremely dangerous in a close encounter. As a general rule, the mudturtle is immune to slashing weapons, so travelers are advised to have a decent club or some scroll of offensive magic on hand'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_VenzelBook_1: Who does not remember Maximus III, the conqueror of Archolos? Who has missed the glory of his son, Mandred, bringing the rebellious colonies back into the kingdom? Who has forgotten how General Lee cut off the head of the Varrantian serpent?
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_VenzelBook_2: The memory of victories in the hearts of men will last as long as burns the fire of our Lord. Though Myrtana's history is strewn with victories, in recent months the defeat of the royal fleet at the Battle of the Eastern Archipelago has fallen upon it like a bolt from the blue.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_VenzelBook_3: As Gerthen, a renowned hunter of game on the continent, wrote in his Treatise on Hunting: 'You will not find a more vile, deceitful and despicable creature in the world than the orc.' It was on that fateful morning that these savage beasts forced the royal fleet to retreat.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_VenzelBook_4: How could Admiral Anskar, a seasoned sea dog, give way to these barbarians? The answer lays in the foul spells of the orc sorcerers. Calling on the name of the cursed Beliar, they summoned a fog as thick as milk, which caused even the best captains of the kingdom to lose direction at sea.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_Volfzacke_Eld: During my many days at the stronghold, I discovered that its inhabitants, calling themselves the 'Wolf Sons', had developed a strong cult centered around their ancestors and their achievements. When I arrived on the island, I was amazed by the peculiar shrines to which the locals brought countless offerings including horns filled with wine. Today I know that this is an important and integral part of their long-standing tradition.
In understanding this phenomenon, one must be guided first and foremost by knowledge of history and who Volfzack was for the people of Archolos.
He, as the one who united the island under one banner, was and is for the locals what Rhobar I is for the Myrtanians - the creator of their world.

The Wolf Sons believe that the ancestors who once walked the corridors of the fortress will watch over them, if only from beyond the grave. And when they themselves are no longer able to protect their brethren, then 'guards will arise from the stone to protect them before they turn to rubble, as they did in the days of their forefathers'.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_WaterMage_01_: The Order of Things in the World

To understand the sacred teaching of Adanos, one must first comprehend the workings of the natural world. The basic characteristics of the universe are variability and constancy. Although these may seem to be contradictory, the opposite is true. One cannot step into the same river twice, says a philosopher, explaining the principle of changeability. Another says, 'But everything has one thing in common: being'.

But due to the fact that we observe some constancy in everything, it is possible to investigate and describe it. Once we know how the world works and begin to examine it slowly, we begin to see the sacred work of Adanos himself in the natural world. First on the physical plane we will see that everything is dynamic, so there must be something behind it that is the cause of that dynamism. We believe that this is Adanos. Everything has a cause, so we seek the ultimate first cause in Adanos. And finally, we see that everything decays, changes, transforms. Could something that decays be a cause for itself? We believe not. Therefore, we look for this cause in Adanos.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_WaterMage_02_: The Order of Things in the World

We have seen how the world and its creator relate to each other. But some things are best to be left as they are. All living things have a special quality - dignity. Because of the nature of living things, it is right to interfere with them, and not with others. It is proper for a mother to love her child. It is also right not to mindlessly kill what can live and produce fruits.

The creator is known by his creation. Similarly, by the order of the world we recognize what Adanos wants from us. First of all, that we faithfully follow his teachings. And it means to apply in practice the knowledge about the harmony, constancy and changeability. If the teachings of Innos were to prevail, everything would come to a standstill. And Beliar, whose domain is death would not bear it. If Beliar were victorious, death would triumph. But when Adanos triumphs by bringing order among his brothers, everything is in its place. The healthy get sick, the sick get well, the happy get sad, the sad get comforted.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_WaterMage_Old: Brother Patracjan keeps me informed about the Southerners’ rebellion. I sorrow all those poor people, doomed to perish in flames. We shall pray three times a day and once every evening burn bundles of Seraphis and myrtle for their souls.
Today we discussed possible solutions on how to help victims of this tragedy. I decided to reopen the sanitarium in the monastery. I also requested brother Rierol to bring every known healing herb.
At the next gathering of the High Council, we discussed providing further help
to people from the town, but the votes appear to be equal. I decided to abstain and put trust in the wisdom of our Lord.

Last night, my heart rejoiced greatly when Adanos bestowed us with another sign. He crumbled the bridge leading to the island as if to oppose our intervention in the town. We live in uneasy times, indeed, full of omens, which we must look for.
Kessel asked for an audience with me yesterday. He said that Volker, a nobleman from the town, is a threat to the balance on the island, but he still searches for strong proof.
WrittenText_BookStand_Lore_WaterMage_Reg: I spoke with Kessel about Jon. He believes his heart is passionate, but also righteous. I told Kessel to take care of him for doubt leads straight to anger, and thus, to evil.
I heard rumours about someone breaking into our archives last night, but nothing seems to be missing. Perhaps some novice could not sleep again. I will have to speak with brother Ingolf about it.
Jon disappeared and Kessel is afraid that the attack in the harbour could be aimed at the Water Ring and that Volker gave the orders. I advised him to restrain his emotions.

I am sure that I saw no Beliar’s poison in our former brother’s heart. Did the Merciful One not give us all an evident sign by crumbling the bridge? We must remain strong in our faith, for He is the only shield protecting us from the evil of this world.

All my worst fears have come true. There was an attempt to take Volker’s life and Jon was the one who stands behind it. Adanos puts our hearts to a test. I am left with no choice. I must speak with my brothers about the dissolution of the Water Ring.
I feel that my strengths are withering day after day. Lord, fill my heart with faith, for the hour of trial is coming.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_1: Melee weapons can be divided into one-handed and two-handed. There is also a division into weapons requiring strenght or dexterity.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_4: -Two-handed, Strength - large axes and large swords
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_7: Each weapon has its advantages and disadvantages, but strength always determines the additional power of the strike.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_8: Do not be fooled by pure strength though - dexterity weapons can be just as deadly, especially if we balance our training.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_9: Strength training can be extremely tiring and cost an incredible amount of work. Meanwhile, a warrior with a spear or sword develops both dexterity and strength. The former allows him to wield extremely comfortable weapons, while even simple strength training will increase the power of his blows.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_10: Regardless of the weapon, training in using it one or both handed is also needed. It allows to make faster strikes, link them into combinations, and more often deliver accurate and stronger blows.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Meele_11: Consciously choose what you feel most comfortable with. Don't be afraid to experiment, don't bet on the simplest solutions, and you will surely become a great fighter.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_1: The basis of a good miner and a good woodcutter is proper posture. You can't mine anything if you don't stand properly next to the deposit. It is also extremely important to observe the material being extracted. This is the only way to know where and how to strike next.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_2: Although seemingly very different, both mining and logging can be categorized as one skill - resource extraction.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_3: Many people mistakenly think that strength or dexterity have some effect on the final results - but the most important thing is simply to practice mining.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_4: This can be gained by mining raw materials, especially those unsuccessful attempts, and also by taking lessons from appropriate teachers.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_5: While mining you can also find additional raw materials - cutting down trees there are always a few branches to turn into arrows, while digging magic ore you can get small amounts of its powdered form.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Mining_6: A sufficiently experienced craftsman can use additional resources during his work. An excellent bowyer will make more arrows from a branch and a master alchemist will get more powdered ore from a single nugget.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Seed_1: Nature on the island of Archolos really can amaze! Many of the plants, due to their size and the irregularity of the winds on the island, have developed seeds that are eaten along with the plant and then distributed by the animals after they have digested them. The seeds have properties similar to those of mature plants, but are only usable if they are extracted from the guts of the beast while it is still digesting them.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Seed_2: Any experienced alchemist will know how to do this, but if you find the right person, they will be able to tell you a thing or two about the process, even without having studied the art of brewing. The use of the seeds, however, is of little use to the person who does not wish to make potions from them.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Seed_3: A casual adventurer does not have the time to watch over the sprouting plants every day for weeks on end. In that case, it is best to simply sell them.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Seed_4: Some species of animals are most fond of particular plants, and that is why you will find the seeds of these plants in their stomachs:
WrittenText_Bookstand_Teach_1: No matter if we develop strength, dexterity, magical knowledge or weapon skills, further learning will require more sacrifice. No potions, amulets or other magical trinkets can change this. Although they instantly strengthen the user, they do not affect his own development.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Teach_2: One should not waste time removing amulets and rings before training. Even more so, one should not save potions that permanently enhance the body or mind until after one has reached the upper limits of abilities. Effects of these potions will then prove of little use in the perspective of many months spent on one's training output.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Teach_3: Balanced development is important. Training only strength, and ignoring the art of wielding weapons, will never deliver the right blow. An archer who knows the secrets of archery and gutting game may benefit more by preparing goblin berries according to a cook's recipe than by spending years mastering alchemy just to make their potential for dexterity a little more efficient.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Teach_4: Don't be afraid to experiment. Beginnings don't require much work, and very often yield tangible benefits. However, think about what abilities you want to develop as much as possible. Devote yourself to them completely, and you will surely become a master in your field.

WrittenText_Bookstand_Thief_1: Only a fool thinks that dexterity will make him a more efficient thief. Agile limbs are of no use if their owner does not know how to use them. Even a man with fat fingers, who knows how to use his shape and mass, can be an amazing thief.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Thief_2: Pickpocketing, like many other skills, can be divided into 3 levels of initiation - beginner, advanced and master. With each new level, pickpocket will be able to steal from more cautious people during talk.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Thief_3: Both an amateur and the greatest master can only steal as much as their target has in his pockets and pouch.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Thief_4: Even a beginner will immediately recognize the person he is unable to steal from. It is enough to look at them carefully, notice their movements and the way their purse is tied.
WrittenText_Bookstand_Thief_5: A skilled thief works routinely, his movements are smooth because they are perfectly learned and memorized - there is no room for error. For the same reason, it is not a very developing occupation and does not develop the user. Rather, a good thief should view pickpocketing as a way to get by and a way to finance his other desires.

If the matter of the inheritance is not cleared up quickly, I fear that the wine trade will suffer greatly. Holdwig, as the older brother, expected to receive the vineyard as an inheritance, but Valerio decided to play a prank on him and bequeathed it along with the estate to his younger brother, Andreas.
WrittenText_SQ225_BRADLOCKBOOK_2: The boy had a head for business, which was to be expected. Holdwig was furious when the will was read out and drove Andreas out by force. Now they both aim to prove the superiority of their rights to the estate...

WrittenText_QA203_Glenwyr_1: The role of the Araxos Merchant Guild in the development of our island's economy cannot be overlooked. The outpost, established by order of the new chairman of the Merchant's Guild, Lorenzo, has allowed many islanders to prosper. The equipment of Araxos has provided the hunters with good conditions for hunting big game, the fishermen have received protection from drowning or sea snakes, the houses of the merchants are guarded in their absence and many workers have found employment in the warehouses of the Guild. Most impressive about the whole affair is the overcoming of the residents' resentment. Years of hearing rumors about the Guild's mangy treatment of merchants on Archolos have done their part, but Lorenzo's bold reforms of the organization seem to have successfully improved relations between Araxos and the public.

WrittenText_QA401_LorenzoLetter_2: - Apparently, one of the merchants from the marketplace is trading with smugglers. From our information, they meet at night somewhere on the west side of the harbor.
WrittenText_QA401_LorenzoLetter_3: - Crates of food have been standing on the pier for some time. From the report, it seems that this is a supply for the smugglers. We need to get rid of these crates under the cover of darkness.

WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_01_1: Where the hell did they come from? I think Beliar himself sent them here to spite me. I can't live on my own, and I have to take care of them?
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_01_2: That Jorn is always talking nonsense. The bloodfly's poison seems to have clouded his mind. He's talking about his mother's amulet and his aquamarine ring. Maybe he's got one of those trinkets on him. If I could sell it, I could make a profit out of this incident.
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_01_3: No sign of the amulet, but I did find an interesting ring on him. Adanos himself must be blessing me today, for all this aquamarine is probably one of the blue stones that the Usurer collects. I must tell him about it, he will certainly be pleased, and a pleased Usurer means a few substantial purses in my pocket.
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_02_1: Not only did I take them under my roof, but they also dare to steal my wine, set aside for a special occasion? A man goes out to the city for a while and they get drunk like pigs. You see, like father, like sons. It's a good thing the Usurer paid me a lot for the information about the ring. Let Jorn bargain with him, since he paid the pirates for the crossing, maybe he'll get something from selling this junk. Then I, as a good uncle, will gladly charge him something for the commission!
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_02_2: Damn, it wasn't supposed to be like that! They were supposed to make a deal, but Jorn disappeared. I just hope he didn't start mouthing off to the Usurer's men. Him with his big mouth! I must speak to the Usurer as soon as possible and try to apologize to him. Let's hope it's not too late!
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_03_1: Volker was really nice today. The guy must have more gold than the King himself! To offer me access to a house in the city while the case is being cleared up? That's generosity! Let's hope that Jorn and I can come to an agreement quickly, or that fool Marvin will make things worse. The boy must have fallen on his head when he was a child because he's a terrible freak. He tries to snoop everywhere and look for his 'evidence'. This kind of thing should be handled by adults. A few more days and all will be clear.
WrittenText_KurtJournal_Page_03_2: The Usurer has finally reached back! Apparently, they finally came to an agreement with Jorn. Damn, that ring really must have been very valuable! He promised that I could meet up with Jorn again today and return to the village peacefully. Just let Marvin hear it! He didn't believe his uncle could handle this on his own. No guards, no Elder, no governor. But I am Kurt!

WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_01_1: My master is dead... I have tried, to myself, justify his actions by the will of Innos... but can terrible deeds, even for the noblest of purposes, be forgiven?
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_01_2: I have witnessed it all and made my own mistakes, so it is not for me to judge. Whoever finds these notes should follow them and make sense of the events themselves. The first of them was hidden quite by accident... During the battle for the only unconquered fortress on this cursed island, I dropped it into the water and it swam downstream towards the waterfalls.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_01_3: They'll be here soon... the door will not hold their bloodlust for long. Innos, take me in.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_02_1: Never in my life had I met someone who praised Innos so highly as Wirgilio. His passion inspired both fascination and horror among Fire Mages. Which is probably why they sent him here, to Archolos. To help tip the balance of victory in our favor... or die trying.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_02_2: When we arrived, there was little more in the hands of our troops than this harbor town. There, on the hill between the rocky hill, on the very first day Wirgilio erected a chapel for our Lord, a place he could talk with him.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_02_3: My master supervised its construction. He would remind the workers to carefully make the heads at the front and back of the chapel... When requests failed, master in his anger threw stones at the imperfect reliefs...
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_03_1: As a novice, I had heard of circles of magical knowledge, the mastery of which could send down a rain of fire from the sky, but... what I saw, heard, and felt at the Battle of Vardhal was indescribable...
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_03_2: My master set the sky ablaze. For three days and nights, the fortress was aflame. The fire was seen across the island. The stench and the heat was felt in nearby villages.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_03_3: The main walls, made of huge rocks, were not so much crumbled as melted and shrunk. The whole area was barren. One could hardly find any living animals. There was nothing left of the outer walls. I climbed them to look at my master's work, at the barely hanging bridge and the ruined fortress.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_04_1: Wirgilio sank deeper and deeper into madness. He noticed that his person aroused horror and contempt rather than respect.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_04_2: I saw him torn... Maybe it was this split that prevented him from raining fire on the only fortress that had never been conquered? On the one hand, he wanted to be the fist of Innos that destroys our Lord's enemies, but on the other, he couldn't indefinitely silence within himself all the screams of terror and pain his flames caused. Or at least that's what I thought...
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_04_3: Ultimately, fanaticism won out in him. I still ponder whether, if I had been by his side at the time, I might have been able to stop him...
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_04_4: But someone had to see to the burial of our own comrades, who were also consumed by the Great Wirgilio's rain of fire... But you will not hear of this from Myrtanians historians. The dead do not lie, and they can be found east of Vardhal itself. The truth is placed in the hands of the paladins.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_05_1: It was the most ordinary summer morning. Two villagers did not kneel as they passed the shrine of Innos. Wirgilio carelessly turned them into ashes and returned to his duties.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_05_2: The news spread in an instant, and townsfolk rushed towards the chapel where the mage resided. He was surrounded by the crowd as he began to pray. He killed more than a dozen before they beat him to death.
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_05_3: Why did no one prevent this? The Water Mages definitely knew about the crowd. Did they not arrive in time? Or maybe they decided it was better for the balance?
WrittenText_SQ414_CONFESSION_05_4: When I came, I tried to stop them, but all I saw in their eyes was pure hatred. First, they threw an apple, then a stone. I felt blood on my head, and I don't know when flames came out of my hands. I ran, but they'll be looking for me.

WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_2: We're on a deadline and they're all slacking!
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_3: Morris is starting to complain. If this goes on... I don't even want to think about what will happen.
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_4: I shouldn't have agreed to hire unqualified people. But where will I find qualified workers now?
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_5: There are more and more refugees on the island. They are desperate. Maybe also hardworking?
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_6: It's worth a try, because I don't think it could be worse.
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_8: I hired an army of people to work and it did nothing!
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_9: Fact, refugees are cheap, but so what if there are no results!
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_10: They must have noticed that the rest are slacking off and not suffering any consequences.
WrittenText_KQ406_DackDiary_11: I am slowly losing my strength for this! I don't know what to do anymore!
WrittenText_KQ405_SCOUTNOTE_2: You were only supposed to force the scout to make a report, not cut his throat! What's more! You were careless enough to stain the letter with his own blood!
WrittenText_KQ405_SCOUTNOTE_3: Do you think the King's men are stupid enough not to ask questions after receiving something like that!
WrittenText_KQ405_SCOUTNOTE_4: The letter must get to his superiors anyway. Soon the guards will start sniffing around here, get rid of the body and clean up this mess.
WrittenText_KQ405_SCOUTNOTE_5: Just throw it in the sewers. The rats will take care of the rest.
WrittenText_KQ405_SCOUTNOTE_6: If you botch this as badly as you botched the letter, you can say goodbye to your empty heads.
WrittenText_KQ407_GRAYSONNOTE_2: Orcs are preparing to invade Archolos. There is no longer any doubt about that. Contrary to what we expected, they will not attack from the harbor side.
WrittenText_KQ407_GRAYSONNOTE_3: From what our scouts have been able to determine, the orcs have taken five strategic positions on the island. Bermar's farm was the first to fall. The civilians who managed to escape have moved towards the city. If we allow the orcs to regroup their troops - may Innos protect us all.
WrittenText_KQ407_GRAYSONNOTE_4: Our advantage is that the orcs are unaware of our knowledge of their plans. Informing Morris and increasing the city's defenses may alert the orcs.
WrittenText_KQ407_GRAYSONNOTE_5: Let me suggest organizing small strike groups. If we can eliminate the orc leaders, the enemy will be disorganized.
WrittenText_KQ407_RODERICHNOTE_1: For many years I have watched you try to realize your big dream of creating an elite city guard unit. The time has come to put it to the test.
WrittenText_KQ407_RODERICHNOTE_2: The orcs are preparing to invade, but it's not too late to stop them. If we launch a quick counterattack and get rid of the orc leaders, we can completely destabilize the enemy troops.
WrittenText_KQ407_RODERICHNOTE_3: I know you are a man of principle - which I respect and appreciate. However, this time I must ask you to cooperate with me without informing Governor Morris - the success of our operation depends on it.
WrittenText_KQ407_RODERICHNOTE_4: I look forward to your response. Marvin is briefed on the entire operation and you are free to discuss the matter with him.
WrittenText_KQ407_LORENZONOTE_1: We haven't always agreed with each other over the past few years, but I value you as a man of business.
WrittenText_KQ407_LORENZONOTE_2: This news is a state secret - not even Morris himself can know about it.
WrittenText_KQ407_LORENZONOTE_3: The orcs are preparing an invasion. My men won't be enough this time. I need your elite mercenaries and hunters. In Kaleb's house you are to organize the main base of our operation and guard the entrances so that no one unauthorized crosses its threshold.
WrittenText_KQ407_LORENZONOTE_4: You know I'm not a supporter of the Guild. If you refuse to support me, I will personally convince the King to outlaw your organization in the whole Kingdom of Myrtana. For an additional incentive, I will privately throw in a lifetime tour of the magic ore mines in Khorinis.
WrittenText_KQ407_LORENZONOTE_5: I await your response, you may speak freely with Marvin about the entire operation.

WrittenText_SQ505_YoungVolker_Letter_1: I know you don't like my job... but I've got to earn money for my parents' medicine somehow. I won't let you be forced to work in the Dark Mysteries! Whatever they say about the Usurer, he pays honestly and on time, not like half the rich people in the city who don't give a damn about us poor people. As long as you follow his orders exactly, he's even quite nice. Just a few more months and we'll think about something else... maybe move to Silbach? I'll buy a piece of land and we'll farm it together.
WrittenText_SQ506_Diary_1: What was all this for? Who cares about a simple life on a farm? Or maybe I just want to pick turnips all my life, and no one will ask my opinion anymore! Instead of doing something useful, I just sweep the mages' chambers all day long.
WrittenText_SQ506_Diary_2: I don't understand, I haven't received any letter from my family for a long time. Do they think I'm a freeloader? Yes, that's definitely it! They wanted to get rid of me to make life easier for themselves! I'll show them, become a mage, and then they'll remember me bitterly...
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_02_2: Mechanical processing doesn't seem to have much effect, but yesterday I noticed how a small flock of scavengers started approaching my plants. Just as I was going to chase them away, my scientist sense commanded me to let nature take its course.
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_02_4: I knew it! By digesting the plant, the scavengers had removed most of its negative side effects.
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_02_5: Of course, there were a few minor changes in their bodies, but who cares about those beasts. Now I just have to adjust the proportions of all the ingredients and the potion should be ready. This breakthrough discovery will forever go down in the history of alchemy!
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_02_7: Too much dragon root? Or maybe not enough eastern violet? What could be wrong? I think my head is about to burst...
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_03_2: After many days of experimentation, I'm coming to the conclusion that the problem wasn't the potion itself, but my test subject. I guess all the potions I poured into him were starting to kick in. Well, there's nothing left for me to do but try out my latest recipe on someone completely new.
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_03_4: What a coincidence, just when I was about to look for a volunteer myself, this boy appeared here. He looks healthy and reasonably strong, he will be perfect for testing my new Potion with Double Dose of Digested Enhanced Fire Root. I'll have to remember to come up with a better name eventually...
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_04_2: Damn! The doubly digested root has lost all its properties! It is notable that the potion has taken on hallucinogenic properties. The boy concluded that I looked like a scavenger. I will return to researching this issue once I have dealt with the potion, I can't afford any distractions!
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINDIARY_04_4: Maybe my mistake all along was trusting in the power of nature? I allowed it to be the scavengers that digested my precious plants when the process should have taken place in some other species. I just have to figure out what would be appropriate...
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINMASTERLETTER_2: What tempted me to bring him with me to Archolos?
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINMASTERLETTER_3: I understand his youthful exuberance, but such experiments are not in keeping with the teachings of Innos himself!
WrittenText_SQ509_BODOWINMASTERLETTER_4: Once he calms down and releases me tomorrow, I will immediately have him transferred to another facility.

WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_RELIGION_1: Hear the words of Gods, for they desire you to hear them. Obey the laws of Gods, for they want you to obey them. Worship the priests of Gods, for they are the chosen ones of grace...
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_RELIGION_2: Words of Innos: And if you cannot comprehend them, do not reject the words of the priests, for they proclaim my wisdom. For I am the Sun in the sky, the light and the life on Earth. And everything that is the enemy of the Sun is also my enemy, and will be banished to the land of eternal darkness.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_RELIGION_3: Words of Adanos: Live and work, for the day was created that the husbandman might live and work. Seek knowledge so that you may pass it on to your sons, for this is my will. But beware, for the foolish and lazy will be banished to the land of eternal darkness.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_RELIGION_4: The words of Beliar: And whoever goes against the will of Gods will be dealt with by me. I will send cruel pain on his body, and his spirit will go with me to the land of eternal darkness.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_ASTRONOMY_1: At the center of the universe is Morgrad, which contains the four elements - earth, water, fire and wind. Morgrad, which is the eternally restless heart of Beliar. And above it extends the realm of the heavens.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_ASTRONOMY_2: In the eternal hierarchy of the cosmos, man stands in the middle. His soul allows him to experience heavenly graces, but his body is made of the substance of Morgrad. Thus man is a reflection of the whole world.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_ASTRONOMY_3: The orbits of all the planets, that is, the paths they take around Morgrad, change slightly with the passing of the years. Therefore, it is certain that the whole universe is slowly moving towards some goal.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_ASTRONOMY_4: By observing the movement of the moon in the night sky, we determined the length of the year and created the first calendar.

WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_MAGIC_3: From time immemorial man has tried to fathom the nature and origins of the magical arts. But where to begin such a search? Can magic be described at all? There is no reason to look for equally incoherent phenomenon in the world: after all, magic cures and kills, creates and destroys alike.
WrittenText_Q501_BOOKSHELF_MAGIC_4: So where to look for this indescribable power? Magic is what it is - the most powerful and magnificent gift that man has received from the gods. WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_1: In the beginning there was chaos.
WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_2: Before the Kingdom of Myrtana saw the light of day, the world was overrun by numerous peoples. Conflicted among themselves, unaware of the truths of the world around them, they were at war forever. Conspiracies, coupled with negotiations in the capitals of their flimsy states, only served to fuel the conflicts.
WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_3: Then, out of the fog of war, heroes emerged who united some of the warring peoples and vowed to lead these lands to a bright future. All those who chose to oppose their rule fled into the shadows and disappeared forever from the pages of history.
WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_4: Despite many hardships, the heroes coordinated the fate of Myrtana for countless days. Although after the first wave of passion, came the bitter everyday reality of creating a better tomorrow, they never gave up. Every day, brick by brick, they built power.
WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_5: Historians today speak of Rhobar and his descendants, but it was the zeal and hard work of dozens of Myrtana's citizens, over countless years, that built this kingdom.
WrittenText_Secret_MyrtanaChronicles_6: The heroes of Myrtana were us. We are the ones who write the Chronicles of Myrtana. You, too, create your own Chronicles of Myrtana every day.
WrittenText_Secret_VardhalCorridors_1: Whatever one may write about these legendary dungeons, someone on Archolos will consider it nonsense. Destroying the chronicles of the island by Myrtanians has had its effect - now hardly anyone is able to distinguish between legend and fact. Only through logic and residual records can we guess what lies in the bowels of this ancient fortress.
WrittenText_Secret_VardhalCorridors_2: We can be almost sure of the huge treasures hidden in the halls of Vardhal, collected over the years by the owners of the fortress,
WrittenText_Secret_VardhalCorridors_3: and which, due to the curse on the place, have not had a chance to be plundered.
WrittenText_Secret_VardhalCorridors_4: But does the fortress hide something whose value cannot be estimated? Does it really hide the tomb of the island's unifier, Volfzack? Was the powerful Adanos artifact, the Peacemaker, deposited there with him? Here, unfortunately, we have more rumors than real historical sources at our disposal.
WrittenText_TELEPORTBOOK_1: Teleportation magic is still a mysterious and unexplored field. No one is able to determine from which of the gods it originated. Some even claim that it does not come from them, but is the pinnacle of the human mind's achievements.
WrittenText_TELEPORTBOOK_2: To use teleportation runes, no knowledge of circles or magic is needed. Anyone can pick up a rune and attempt to teleport to its assigned location. Few, however, will be transported instantly. It is an innate gift that even years of learning cannot replace.
WrittenText_TELEPORTBOOK_3: For all others, an approach to a place of power is required.
WrittenText_TELEPORTBOOK_4: Many researchers and mages have further enhanced these places with the symbol of a pentagram enclosed in a circle. This technique created teleportation networks in many regions of the world. Supposedly, it was taken from the priests of the Wolf Sons, who used them to create point teleporters. It is not known how they developed such magic.

WrittenText_WolfsSonOldDiary_2: Now there is no turning back, the gate is closed. We tried to break it down, but our battering rams are crumbling on it. Some have started waving in the air like they're fighting something. Others simply fell on their own blades. More people are jumping off the walls... WrittenText_NostalgicBook_1: To find true peace within yourself, you need to revisit the memories of the carefree days of yore.
WrittenText_NostalgicBook_2: Each of us cherishes fleeting moments when we were happy and had no worries. However, they are often lost deep in our memories.
WrittenText_NostalgicBook_3: The best way to return to them is to recall them with the same sights we experienced then.
WrittenText_NostalgicBook_4: However, we are not always able to return to places from our better days, which is why it makes sense to recreate beautiful situations from our lives - whether it was hunting with our best companions, baking delicious bread with our mother, or fishing with our father.
WrittenText_NostalgicBook_5: Doing the same thing, even without them and in a completely different place, we can escape temporal problems for a moment and feel as if we are once again abiding in those wonderful moments.

WrittenText_AboutNordmar_1: Far to the north of Myrtana's borderlands, stand the snow-capped peaks of Nordmar - a frozen, inaccessible land, home to a proud warrior people. There is a reason they are called that, as for centuries they have been the target of invasions by the Orc tribes of the vast Northern Plains.
WrittenText_AboutNordmar_2: Though Nordmar itself is a cold land, its people have hot blood in their veins, and so they prefer to solve any problem with their fists, sword or axe. No wonder - their life consists of constant fighting with enemies or the forces of nature.
WrittenText_AboutNordmar_3: These robust, hardy people have repeatedly proven their skill not only in wielding weapons, but also in working them on the anvil.
WrittenText_AboutNordmar_4: From an early age, Nordmarian boys are taught the art of survival. When they reach adulthood, as a test of their manhood, their fathers send them into the wilderness to retrieve a shadowbeast's horn. Adolescent women, on the other hand, are taught by their mothers the craft and care of the home in order to fulfill their future duty as good wives and mothers.
WrittenText_AboutVarrant_1: A true merchant will not learn his trade at village fairs and festivals, pushing pendants and trinkets to the public for half a price. The lesson after which, dear reader, you will be able to call yourself a gold-master of coinage, will be given you only by the Scarlet Road, stretching for many miles from Southern Myrtana to Middle Varrant.
WrittenText_AboutVarrant_2: It is said that the name of this southern-scorched route derives from the goods sold along it, such as crimson wines from Montilia, rubies mined from the mines of Vallaros, and exotic, spicy spices from the Saffron Oasis. Others argue that the scarlet refers to the blood that was bought by the fairs slaughtered along the trail.
WrittenText_AboutVarrant_3: Despite the ongoing war and civil unrest, the Scarlet Route area is full of challenges and surprises, awaiting amateur and experienced traders alike. While I could write the story of my life and how I came to my fortune in the pages of this book, I will not. No amount of theory can replace the valuable practice you will gain by traveling from market to market, learning local customs, and making promising contacts.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_1: Whether you are a simple merchant or a knowledgeable scientist, you have surely noticed that the world is governed by a predetermined order. Farmers in the fields bend their necks in the scorching sun of the day, and weary travelers find their way home thanks to the moon's light at night. The abundant rains make plants grow faster, and the ore exposed to fire can be shaped on the anvil at will over time.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_2: Countless treatises have been written trying to explain what this unknown force is that sets the world and all its elements in motion. Although many awe-inspiring speculations have been made on the subject, the theory closest to the truth is that this influence comes from the heavens, where Innos has his seat.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_3: It is he who, like a skilled miller, turns the wheel of life day after day, pushing the discs of the sun and moon over the sky, creating rain clouds and stoking the fires in the hearths.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_4: While it would be heartening to simple hearts and minds to accept the position that Innos is a personified entity, scholars should treat him purely metaphorically, as a kind of Causal Power that gives momentum to the world and one that must be endlessly studied.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_02_1: Understanding Innos not as a personified god, but as an idea of causality, order of nature and perfection of action, people, occupying the lowest position in the spherical division of the world, should be considered adequately as the least perfect. Proof of this is the fact that we make mistakes. Innos, on the other hand, does not make mistakes at all, and if there is an exception to the rule, it is considered to be a widely understood and judgment-free 'divine will'.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_02_2: It should surprise no one, therefore, why the gates of heaven are sealed tight against man. Are we therefore destined to remain forever subject to the laws of a higher, incomprehensible force?
WrittenText_DrivingForce_02_3: After all, we can in no way influence the sphere that is fundamentally inaccessible to us. However, we have been bestowed with reason, which, although does not allow us to reach the heavens, makes us able to bring their particle down to earth.
WrittenText_DrivingForce_02_4: An example of such a divine particle is wine production. The sun, which is the work of the Causal Power, warms the grapes through the summer, which can be harvested by the farmers in the fall. Then the man transforms the knowledge and kneads the grapes. Then he puts them through a process of fermentation, and after a few months pours the prepared beverage into bottles.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_01_1: No traveler known to the world, whose name has been written in gold in the pages of history, has been able to estimate the size and shape of the entire continent. From numerous books and reports, however, we know that it is vast, stretching from the windswept plains of Nordmar in the north to the sun-baked wastelands of Varrant in the south. It is separated from the east by the blue surface of the Sea of Myrtana, and from the west by the Boundless Steppes stretching for hundreds of miles.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_01_2: Politicians, for simplicity or to seek the King's approval, often refer to it as the largest political entity on it - the Kingdom of Myrtana. Scholars, on the other hand, prefer to use the name 'The Blessed Continent'.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_01_3: For it is a blessing to have peoples with vastly different traditions, beliefs and forms of government living side by side.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_01_4: Despite innumerable political and religious conflicts, plagues and migrations, the continent's three dominant cultures - Myrtanian, Nordmarian and Varrantian - have stood the test of time, becoming an inseparable part of it.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_02_1: According to the few surviving sources, we know that the area of present-day Myrtana was once covered by dense forests where trolls, shadowbeasts and much older beasts, forgotten by time, reigned. One day, however, a creature unknown to these lands appeared within their borders. It was a man. In the midst of unspoiled forests and wilderness, huts sprang up one after another like mushrooms, which with time began to grow into wooden settlements, then villages, and finally brick cities.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_02_2: While the evidence is clear that the first people to arrive on the east coast of the continent were the Myrtanians, they were soon joined by two other groups.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_02_3: The first, wandering for weeks through the inhospitable southern wilderness, established the settlement of Varrant in the An'hita River basin. The second group took the northern route along the ridge of the Ash Mountains, which led them to a valley battered by the freezing winds. There they established the stronghold of Fjellborg, the capital of present day Nordmar.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_02_4: Although the members of each culture share many similarities, the lands in which they made their homes, the customs they followed, and the faith to which they gave their hearts have all conditioned their sovereignty over the years.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_03_1: According to a report by Royal Scribe Sevinus, native Myrtanians make up a second part of the total population of the known part of the continent. However, this is not surprising. For the Kingdom of Myrtana, in its current dimension, is the beating heart of human civilization, and its kings, like good shepherds, 'tirelessly carry the light to people all over the world'.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_03_2: How, then, in the proximity of Myrtana, did the Varrantians and Nordmarians manage to preserve their cultural identity? The answer lies in geography. For a single trade route leads from Myrtana to Varrant, situated between Ruby Bay to the south and the slopes of the Ash Mountains to the north.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_03_3: Nordmar, on the other hand, is a valley surrounded on all sides by mountain ranges that naturally separate the land from the influence of the outside world.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_03_4: The spirit of Varrantians and Nordmarians is extremely difficult to break. Living in the shadow of orc bands of the Northern Plains, the people of Nordmar must always remain vigilant to defend their homes. The Varrantians have never had enough natural resources themselves, so they learned to take from others. Both of these cultures are characterized by hardiness, which has no doubt helped them keep their integrity.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_04_1: It is important to remember that the climate of both lands plays an important role in the formation and maintenance of the sovereignty of the cultures of Varrant and Nordmar. Because of the dry season that lasts nearly eight months in the Middle Varrant area, its inhabitants like to wear light jackets or leather capes and airy linen pants. The huts of the Varrantians often have no shutters or doors and are replaced by curtains stretched across the entire width of the hut, protecting the inhabitants from the sun and insects.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_04_2: The people of Nordmar, on the other hand, are accustomed to wearing thick sheepskin coats, insulated pants and heavy coats to keep out the cold.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_04_3: Unlike the inhabitants of Varrant and Myrtana, they live in houses made of hard-sawn logs covered with a thick layer of clay on the outside and animal skins.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_04_4: The climate of Varrant and Nordmar also influenced the style of fighting preferred by the inhabitants of these countries. Clad in light, unrestrictive clothing, Varrants prefer to wield light one- or two-handed weapons such as seymites and javelins. The Nordmarians, on the other hand, tightly wrapped in several layers of clothing, have limited mobility, so they usually train to fight with straight, double-edged wedges or axes, valuing above all the power and momentum of their blows.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_05_1: Faith in Innos, the patron saint of Myrtana, is being tested day by day in the face of the War with the Orcs, the plague plaguing the south of the Kingdom and the unrest in the streets of Vengard. And as the main religion on the continent wanes, other religions gain followers.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_05_2: Although the origins of the belief in Beliar in Varrant are shrouded in mystery, the Book of Fire speaks of four Black Mages who instilled a hatred for Innos into the people of this land. Scholars, on the other hand, argue that the Lord of Death originated in the hearts of the people as an idea to counterbalance the Myrtanians, who were leading the continent.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_05_3: It is worth noting, however, that this religion promotes the cult of strength and the power of the strong over the weak, which in turn fits perfectly with the plundering nature of the Varrantians.
WrittenText_BlessedContinent_05_4: The people of Nordmar, on the other hand, are not a people of deep faith. Day after day they struggle against nature, which usually provides them with generous harvests, and they have long since learned to trust their own abilities. There are, however, those who make symbolic offerings, whether out of tradition or precaution, to unspecified nature deities - at the edges of forests, in rushing streams and on snowy mountain slopes.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_01_1: Despite a pack of wolves following our trail, we made it to the gates of Vardhal without much difficulty. Barthos spoke the truth about the size of this fortress. Before fire and time turned it to ruins, it must have been impressive!
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_01_2: I helped Kerran set up camp, in case the beasts crossed the bridge. We won't take a step further today. Besides, we have to wait for Sevinus and the rest of the tools anyway.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_01_3: I'm the one standing guard today.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_01_4: I just hope it doesn't rain. And that there is some wine left in the bottle.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_02_1: It only took a moment's inattention for wolves to sneak into camp in the middle of the night. Damn beasts! We would have dealt with them long ago if Ioris hadn't been sitting with her nose in those useless books! The animals bit Kerran, but to my eye he'll lick it up. He's a tough guy.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_02_2: In the morning, Sevinus returned and brought the rest of the tools for building the footbridge to the other side of the ravine. He also brought something like a key that will help us open the gates to the fortress. I wonder how he plans to do that. Thanks to Adanos for having some of that wine left. I feel like I'll still need it.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_03_1: The night before last, I didn't sleep very well. I drifted from side to side for a couple of hours, and when I did manage to fall asleep, I was awakened by nightmares different from my usual ones.
WrittenText_WolfSonVardhal_03_2: In them, I walked down a dark hallway toward the light. But with each step I took further, the light got further and further away.
