The stone keep of the ruler was situated in the eastern part of the town, near the mountain range where today the Old Town is located.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_01_4: Up north from there, was a fishing hamlet which in time expanded to the size of a village. Volfzack, aware of the evident profits of seafaring, joined the seaside settlement to the town and erected a high fence around the entire agglomeration.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_02_1: After the conquest of Archolos by king Maximus III, the island fell into the hands of Myrtanians, and with it began the age of grand changes.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_02_2: The new ruler promised to pardon people who were once loyal to Volfzack’s sons. The king allowed them to keep their offices under one condition - they had to bow their heads before Innos and consider Maximus their new ruler.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_02_3: The king also conducted reforms of administration. Many solutions utilised in Vengard were introduced at that time. Although in the effect the old culture was rooted out of the city, the management vastly improved ever since.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_02_4: Another step the new ruler took was getting rid of the elders. In their place, a governor together with judges and their deputies were appointed. In time, when the new system began to function properly, the latter were delegated to other duties, and a new office of the royal scribe was created, focused on citizens’ matters.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_02_5: Even long years after the conquest, Maximus was aware of the risk of rebellion. Thus, he decided to leave the garrison of the royal guard in Archolos until a trained unit of a City Guard is created.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_03_1: The work of rebuilding Archolos by the Myrtanian style began with replacing gravel paths with paved roads intertwined with arcades and overpasses erected by a famous sculptor Alberto of Khorinis. At the same time, the building of the town sewers began, which were meant to help residents get rid of waste.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_03_2: Before the Myrtanian invasion, most of the huts and houses in the town were constructed of wood, and thus, they were vulnerable to natural forces. To increase their durability, the authorities reinforced stone buildings using the timber framing method, widely used across Myrtana.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_03_3: The changes also occurred within the Old Town. Due to strategic reasons, Maximus decided to tear down old quarters that had belonged to elders and replace them with a town hall. He also demolished the wooden palisade surrounding the Old Town and erected stone walls together with two gates. As the years went by, another two were added in the middle.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_03_4: In the western part of Archolos, in no more than a year, the authorities built a magnificent Church of Innos next to the small chapel which remembers the days of the invasion. It is the highest building in town to this day and serves as a significant landmark.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_04_1: Maximus knew that the true protection to the growing town can provide only durable fortifications, so he surrounded the entire urban area with stone walls. Later, the king also erected a wide barbican protecting the western gate.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_04_2: Words about the king’s victory on Archolos swept the seas in just a few weeks. Merchants, adventurers, and common people alike would come to the shores on their boats, cutters, and frigates hoping to better their financial situation. It was not long before the town streets would be teeming with outsiders from all around the world.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_04_3: Seeing great numbers of refugees crowding in, governor Godfrey expanded the harbour area and appointed a group of additional officials to better control the newcomers. On the other hand, to ease the hardship of their journey, he allowed them to build temporary huts near the shore.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_04_4: But nobles of Archolos did not trust foreigners and demanded to close the town borders indefinitely. Although this decision would appease one, influential group of citizens, it would also plunge the entire region into an economic crisis. Godfrey had to tread lightly, as every decision was bound to a risk.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_05_1: Although Godfrey did not want to take any side, he had a plan up his sleeve. The governor divided Archolos into districts, hoping to better control the influx of foreigners skilled in different trades.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_05_2: The first district was the Old Town, where only the rich citizens of Archolos were allowed to live. After that, a Residential District was built for the middle class, which until today remains the largest of all, stretching between both outer gates. Later, the craftsman district was created, which gathered people working in different trades.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_05_3: As the last one, the Merchant District was demarcated, which initially covered the area of today’s barracks, the western part of the town, and the temple district. Each of the districts was also separated with a specific building layout, designed in a way to help people move around the town.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_05_4: Although the governor’s plan had its merits, some openly opposed it. The indigenous residents accused authorities of segregating people on those of better stock - foreign, and the worse - local. And they were partly right. Nobles simply refused to breathe the same air as commoners.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_06_1: Despite dividing the town into separate districts, foreigners still crowded in the harbour. Each with a story to tell, experience and prejudices. An overpopulated shore more and more resembled a pot that could spill at any moment.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_06_2: Determined to stop the uncontrollable influx of outsiders, the governor built a wall on the border with the harbour guarded by Royal Guard. His decision angered foreigners, who started a revolt which lasted many days.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_06_3: Although the uprising was brutally quenched, it was never forgotten.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_06_4: The outsiders tried to make their ends meet in any way possible. Smuggling and uncontrolled trade of swamp weed flourished on Archolos which forced Maximus to put an embargo on its distribution.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_06_5: The line between the rich and the poor was more and more visible, and people’s trust in authorities was forever tarnished. It was the time when the faith in Innos weakened amongst commoners, and the religion of Adanos, increased. Water Mages took advantage of this tendency and built a chapel in the harbour, which to this day remains open for the sick and the poor.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_07_1: After the unsuccessful conquest of Contir and Glenwyr, the king returned to the mainland and took with him almost the entire army. This decision was met with mixed feelings from the inhabitants of Archolos. The locals were afraid of another rebellion. Foreigners, on the other hand, saw their chance for gaining more rights. The governor made sure that all of them were content.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_07_2: From the selected group of citizens, Godfrey appointed a unit of the City Guard, tasked to maintain law and order after the king’s departure. Soon after, the barracks were built in the middle of the town.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_07_3: Regular guardsmen and elite companies of crossbowmen became an armed wing of Archolos.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_07_4: The governor also simplified the way of obtaining citizenship by foreigners. Instead of waiting long years for their turn, all they had to do was convince several influential people in the town about their usefulness to society.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_07_5: Eventually, envoys of many guilds and trade companies began to invest their wealth into local markets. There was plenty of work with transporting goods, as well as in sale, thus many new opportunities were opened for citizens and foreigners alike.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_08_1: Godfrey should have listened to the words of an old scribe, Holger - ‘Never trust a merchant. Give them a finger, and they’ll chop your hand off - not for what you hold in it, but for that ring you’re wearing!’ But Holger died, and soon after Godfrey, both of an unspecified illness.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_08_2: The new governor, Karsten, despite high hopes - for he was of noble blood - was a mediocre administrator and even worse politician. He did nothing to resolve the ‘troll problem’ in the sewers, and as a result, people began to spill all the filth right on the streets, as they do to this day on Londram.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_08_3: Some began to suspect that the governor is but a puppet in the hands of trade guilds, which have been gaining more and more power in town. The doubts were quelled the moment Karsten realised that he no longer needed the support of the Town Council, whose members he drove out of the town hall.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_08_4: The governor befriended, however, a group of merchants with a Myrtanian trade magnate, Delaverd. If the stories are true, during a night-long libation, Karsten signed a treaty appointing the ‘Easter League’ which led to declaring an open rebellion against the crown.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_09_1: Although at first, it could appear that Karsten fell victim to his fondness for beverages, the document was signed and in time the governor began to realize what he had done. The 'Eastern League ’became a fact.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_09_2: Banners of Myrtana disappeared from the town hall building, walls, and city gates, and in their place appeared a sign of a triple knot, symbolizing the islands of Archolos, Londram, and Contir which first revolted against the kingdom. After them, Laran, Eritros, and smaller islands of the New Lands and Eastern Archipelago seceded from Myrtana.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_09_3: Patrols of the City Guard were replaced by groups of mercenaries serving not law but coin. Karsten understood what he had done with a single swing of his quill, however, it was too late to stop the chain of events. In his grief, the governor threw himself from the highest window of the town hall, to save his name from an entire shame.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_09_4: The king of Myrtana, Mandred, decided to quench the rebellion by sending a well-equipped armed force across the sea. Although the war only grazed Archolos, hastily formed units of men-at-arms laid waste to the countryside, murdering, pillaging, and burning whatever they found on their way.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_10_1: Having lost contact with most of its harbour towns, the fleet of the Eastern League was defeated, and the organisation itself dissolved. King Mandred brought peace to the rebelled colonies and rebuilt the administrative system. He also appointed the only legal merchant union in Myrtana - the Araxos Guild.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_10_2: One of the first guild houses emerged on Archolos in the western part of the Merchant District. Many years later, governor Morris allowed the guild’s chairman to build quarters for mercenaries, people who sought fame and fortune in the service of the organisation.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_10_3: After the fall of the Eastern League, patrols of the City Guard returned to the streets, but their old prestige did not. They lacked discipline and equipment, which made people doubt the efficiency of order in Archolos. Only today, under captain Roderich, the City Guard began to regain its respect.
WrittenText_HistoryOfCity_10_4: Years passed, and Archolos managed to overcome storms that crashed against it. Its people, however, no longer resemble their forefathers. They are proud and hardened in the fire of history and ready to face the winds of war which slowly blow closer to their home.
WrittenText_Language_01_1: The poet Widron in one of his works wrote: 'there are as many languages in the world as there are stars in the sky.' This is partially true. Whether you are in Vengard, Khorinis or Archolos, you are bound to encounter people from all corners of the world speaking different dialects.
WrittenText_Language_01_2: You'll find mercenaries from the Southern Islands, armed to the teeth, merchants from Middle Varrant selling their wares to the locals for half-price and grumpy Nordmarians spending their days in taverns.
WrittenText_Language_01_3: Although each of them speaks western tongue, a set of common linguistic rules that facilitate communication, it is impossible not to notice some discrepancies.
WrittenText_Language_01_4: Vengardian use characteristic hard consonants. The inhabitants of Archolos, on the other hand, have trouble articulating the melodious names of newcomers from southern Myrtana.
WrittenText_Language_01_5: Believers will say that Innos tangled people's tongues as punishment for them bowing to Beliar. Scholars, however, will say that the diversity of dialects and accents in the world is rooted in the natural process of the development of different cultures.
WrittenText_Language_02_1: Languages and dialects were, are and will be artificial creations, created not as divine intervention, but as one of the key elements of the process of formation of different cultures in different regions of the world. To better understand their issue, I will use examples.
WrittenText_Language_02_2: Native Vengardians, but also newcomers who wish to be understood, often clearly articulate certain elements of speech, especially in names of foreign origin. The southern name 'Sahrad' is spoken by them literally. The people of Zandir Sol, on the other hand, read it as 'sarad' with the hard consonant 'h' omitted.
WrittenText_Language_02_3: The linguistic differences, however, are not only at the level of speech, but also in the way words are accented. The inhabitants of the Eastern Archipelago stress the first syllable when pronouncing their own names. In the word 'Archolos', however, the stress on the syllable 'Ar' may also have historical connotations, as the name of the island was once devoid of the prefix 'Arc-'.
WrittenText_Language_02_4: Language is a fluid thing, depending on where the people who speak it were born. However, it is also a kind of richness. We should still keep the memory of our roots alive by nurturing accents and dialects before they can be found only between the pages of history.
WrittenText_BensContract_3: You will go to the village of Silbach and bring me one guy from there.
WrittenText_BensContract_4: The hut where he is staying is just behind the inn, where the commoners live.
WrittenText_BensContract_5: Don't worry, scouting the place and destination will be done by my man who will accompany you. Your task is to transport  and make sure that our guest will not cause any trouble. Just don't let your hand slip - the guy has to reach me alive.
WrittenText_BensContract_6: By the way, demolish that shack a bit - the whole thing should look like a burglary.
WrittenText_BensContract_7: Knowing your reputation, I will send the gold in advance, you will find it in the pouch attached to this letter.
WrittenText_VolkersOfferForLorenzo_2: Our interests have not always gone together, but I have always valued you as a prudent chairman.
WrittenText_VolkersOfferForLorenzo_3: That is why I offer you to join our cause. Ulryk and I will rid our city of Myrtanians. It is the only way Rhobar will not drag us down with his kingdom.
WrittenText_VolkersOfferForLorenzo_4: Together with your troops, we may even be able to take the city peacefully - think of how many lives we could save!
WrittenText_VolkersOfferForLorenzo_5: I believe you will excel as the minister of economy of our New Archolos.
WrittenText_VolkersOfferForLorenzo_6: Think fast - when the bells ring, join my men. Forgive such a short notice, but you understand, I cannot afford to take risks.
WrittenText_GraysonSearchLetter_2: Whoever has any information on the current whereabouts of Royal Guard recruit Marvin, should report to City Hall as soon as possible.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Meele_1: Since the dawn of time, humans have had to contend with all sorts of beasts, including other humans who try to take from them what they've won so far. The key to success in this fight is knowing the different types of damage, defense and their interrelationships.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Meele_2: The most common type of damage you will experience is edge damage otherwise known as damage from blades. These come from all kinds of swords, spears, and axes, as well as claws and fangs of monsters. Its overall usefulness is very high, but in few fights it gives a significant advantage.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Meele_3: The next type of damage is the blunt damage. Such damage is done by mace, hammers, fists, and many monsters that strike with a large paw or head. Blows are especially effective against heavy armor, bones, or boulders.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Meele_4: Ranged weapons always cause projectile wounds. Like edge wounds, they have high overall utility, but in a few cases they are practically useless - arrows bounce off stone or even thick leather, and hitting skeleton bones is not easy either.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_1: The hardest type of damage to describe by far is flight, wind, and fall damage. This is a very diverse category that includes attacks that are not very common. No armor has yet been created to protect against these types of wounds - each creature has its own resistance to them.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_2: For humans, learned acrobatics may prove to be the only additional protection, as it allows them to properly distribute the energy of the blow. Usually, the larger and heavier the creature, the greater the resistance, while light and bony creatures are extremely susceptible to them.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_3: The next type of damage is magic damage - and it comes directly from spells.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_4: Additionally, most spells also cause an elemental reaction, which can weaken or strengthen the damage depending on the creature that is subjected to it.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_5: Water can shatter stone into tiny pieces, fire can incinerate the undead, and lightning can instantly kill flying creatures.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic_6: Poison and acid damage from certain toxic creatures works in a similar fashion.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_1: The magic damage associated with specific elements also seems to be affected by the weather.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_2: During a downpour, the power of spells related to lightning increases significantly, while the effectiveness of fire spells decreases.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_3: Don't underestimate the weakness of a certain magic! Lightning, for example, doesn't need a downpour to do massive damage to water.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_4: The last type of damage is fire damage and should not be confused with the fire elemental reaction mentioned earlier.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_5: Fire defense allows you to protect yourself from flames coming from a non-magical source - such as a fire lizard's breath - as well as from burning effects caused after being hit by a fire spell.
WrittenText_TypeOfDamage_Magic2_6: Although these are very rare types of damage, you should be adequately protected as they can kill in the blink of an eye.
WrittenText_Wine_01_1: For some people, wine is an essential drink for peasants and lords alike, for others it is an important part of the daily ritual. As Cynred, a long-time advisor of King Mandred, rightly observed: 'the role and importance of wine are changing as fast as the opinion of politicians'.
WrittenText_Wine_01_2: Famous for their distrust of strangers, people from Glenwyr tend to drink a lot. Not without reason, they have adopted the adage: 'iron can be known through fire, man can be known through wine'. Londramians, on the other hand, like to seal their meetings with wine.
WrittenText_Wine_01_3: In time, wine brought the interest of medics and barbers, for whom this drink became almost synonymous with medicine. The latter liked its analgesic properties so much that they assured their clients: 'After a cup of red, you will feel neither iron nor fire!'
WrittenText_Wine_01_4: Alchemists, on the other hand, repeat like a mantra: 'After a cup you will take away the pain from the body. After two, you will soothe the soul. After three, you will knock on the gates of Innos'. They were the first to discover that consuming large amounts of wine can have a detrimental effect on human health.
WrittenText_Wine_02_1: Although people began to be aware of the harmfulness of wine abuse, in no way did this knowledge affect wine consumption. When someone happened to overdo, an adage popular in the time of King Maximus was invoked: 'He who drinks wine sleeps well. He who sleeps well is free from sin. He who does not sin goes to the bosom of Innos.'
WrittenText_Wine_02_2: Philus, the Archmage of Fire from the monastery on the island of Eritros, took this sentence to heart. The priest discovered that this beverage, when properly prepared, has certain magical properties.
WrittenText_Wine_02_3: True to his word, he was so engrossed in his research that he and his brothers locked the gates of the sanctuary for seven full days, during which 'the High Council partied like a group of jesters'.
WrittenText_Wine_02_4: Shortly after these events, the Archmages of Vengard recalled Philus, and wine arriving to monasteries began to be diluted with water. Despite that, abbeys continued to produce wine. It was not until Archmage Witger issued an edict, under which he ordered the priests to consume as much wine 'to have the strength to stand on their feet during the service'.
WrittenText_Wine_03_1: The author of 'First Power', Geber, argues that wine is a gift from heaven, belittling the invaluable role of winemakers in the production of this drink. While this is undoubtedly a complicated process, I will present you with four key steps that will prove that the credit goes to man first and foremost.
WrittenText_Wine_03_2: A skilled vintner must know when to pick and when to leave the fruit. If he picks them too early, they may turn out inedible and the taste of the wine will be tart. If he picks them too late, the taste will be too sweet and some grapes will simply rot. Pick one grape from each bush and taste it, then you will know if it is the right time.
WrittenText_Wine_03_3: After you have picked the grapes, place them in a tub where you mash them. Do this carefully and patiently, and the fruit will certainly thank you by releasing its juices. Then, put the must in a vat covered with sheepskins for a few days to start the fermentation process. From time to time, push the skins and twigs up to the surface.
WrittenText_Wine_03_4: Once you think your wine is starting to get strong and clear, pour it through strainers into oak barrels and seal tightly for one or two springs. After that time you can pour the wine into more barrels and wait half of that time to achieve the desired taste, color and texture.
WrittenText_Wine_04_1: Although the production of wine is dependent on the skill and experience of winemakers, it is not uncommon for their efforts to fail and for the beverage prepared for months or years to rot. Many methods have been devised to deal with the acidity of wine.
WrittenText_Wine_04_2: A popular way to preserve wine is to add sulphur to it. If stories are true, a merchant, called Clement of Sendar, came up with the idea and accidentally poured a stock of 20-year-old beverage into a barrel filled with sulphur.
WrittenText_Wine_04_3: When he opened the lid many months later and saw what he had done, he realised that the taste and texture remained the same.
WrittenText_Wine_04_4: Another method, favoured by Myrtanian winemakers, involves pouring a thick layer of oil or molerat tallow on top of the ageing wine. This method is also used for sealing bottles with wine, which necks are additionally protected with wax.
WrittenText_Wine_04_5: Before pouring wine into barrels, many winemakers add honey, herbs and spices to improve the taste. However, there are con artists who cleverly use this procedure to hide the nasty taste of cheap wine, which is often nothing more than a by-product of the maceration process.
WrittenText_Wine_05_1: Knowledge of making and preserving wine is often not enough to keep it from spoiling. Many merchants, however, have no qualms about selling bottles of stale wine. Valerio, the owner of a vineyard on Archolos, used to comment on this state of affairs with the words: 'you won't believe how much of that shit they sell to people at the markets'.
WrittenText_Wine_05_2: Peter of Montillia believed that the process of winemaking starts not from harvesting, but from planting the bushes. He proved that volcanic soil has unique properties and that plants grow faster there than those planted anywhere else in the world.
WrittenText_Wine_05_3: Although, like any exemplary Montillian, he practised using a row system with supports for the bushes, he suggested leaning the vines against trees as an alternative method. This is because they are supposed to ensure the free and natural development of the plant.
WrittenText_Wine_05_4: A Southern Islands winemaker, Kerhima, wrote in her diary valuable observations about the work in the vineyard itself. She believed that the stage of crushing the fruits should be preceded by washing the vessel with salted water. This treatment was proven to purify the wine, making it excellent for medicinal purposes.
WrittenText_Wine_06_1: If you ask a winemaker about the cradle of wine, you will hear stories about the picturesque hills and valleys of southern Myrtana. But if you tell him to point you to the beating heart of this drink, he will say it's Archolos.
WrittenText_Wine_06_2: For many years, two local winemakers fought for supremacy in the Archolos wine market. The first of them, Valerio, has always produced strong, clean and noble wines.
WrittenText_Wine_06_3: The second one, Arrazola, on the other hand, produced lighter drinks with a sweeter, fruity bouquet.
WrittenText_Wine_06_4: In a constant pursuit for customers, both families duplicated or improved the ideas of the opponent, thus losing the essence of their own wines.
WrittenText_Wine_06_5: These actions, however, contributed to the implementation of many revolutionary ways of wine production, and these in turn strengthened the wine market on the island.
WrittenText_Wine_06_6: During one of the evening tastings at a local hostelry, the owners of both vineyards finally decided to bury the hatchet. After much negotiation (and many emptied goblets of wine), they agreed that the island was big enough for both of them.
WrittenText_VillageStatus_1: The following offenses are subject to a fine:
WrittenText_VillageStatus_2: -Theft - regardless of the value or size of the item
WrittenText_VillageStatus_3: -Picking fights - except for honourable duels or self-defence
WrittenText_VillageStatus_4: -Attacking livestock - in the village of Silbach the only person who has the right to slaughter is the butcher
WrittenText_VillageStatus_5: -Distribution of illegal goods - according to the royal register
WrittenText_VillageStatus_6: -Murder - according to Myrtanian tradition, witnesses to a murder are entitled to immediate punishment, but if the perpetrator gets away with it, they can pay a fine as compensation.
WrittenText_VillageStatus_7: The following offenses do not count toward the fine, but they do allow the victim to use self-defense:
WrittenText_VillageStatus_8: -Breaking into a home without the owner's consent - an exception is made for any commercial premises marked with appropriate signs.
WrittenText_VillageStatus_9: -Touching trunks, chests and containers - even if there has not yet been a theft
WrittenText_VillageStatus_10: -Provoking fights by drawing weapons or magic
WrittenText_VillageStatus_11: All other complaints and offenses will be dealt with taking into account their detriment to the general population of Silbach village first and foremost.
WrittenText_VillageStatus_12: You are also advised that all charges must be dropped if no eyewitness can testify to the offense.
WrittenText_VillageStatus_13: Signed, Albyn, Village Elder and steward on behalf of the noble Sir Ramsey, Lord of Silbach.
WrittenText_SoakedJournal_2: We sailed out of the harbour late. They say the wind is not strong enough. My squad mate, Detlef, heard ... that Admiral Anskar had to ... some mutineers. I was assigned as a sailor of the 'Pride of Myrtana'. I thought the ship was larger than that ... As we set sail, several men are hastily completing the rear mast restoration work. I hope it will hold off.
WrittenText_SoakedJournal_4: It's been three days since we left Vengard, and only today we had Lieutenant Mario's first roll-call.
WrittenText_SoakedJournal_5: It was a rather typical talk ... someone in the crowd said he'd done something in the Battle of Varrant. Maybe he did, but what does a land army commander know about fighting at sea? The admiralty must’ve gone mad.
WrittenText_SoakedJournal_7: We lost two of our frigates yesterday. They say they crashed into the rocks near Khorinis. Mario says it was that damn fog ... but people are talking about the admiral's mistake. And the orcs. Somewhere out there are these bastards ... Let them get their mouths out of that milk, and we will greet them the Myrtanian way - with cannon fire!
WrittenText_EasternArchipelago_1: I am forwarding this letter to the governors and stewards of all the royal colonies.
WrittenText_EasternArchipelago_2: The clash with the orcs in the Eastern Archipelago ended in defeat and the demise of the fleet. As a result, His Majesty, King Rhobar II, has acquired exclusive rights to all vessels sailing the seas.
WrittenText_EasternArchipelago_3: It is ordered to await the arrival of royal envoys with orders within the next few months. The country's policy remains unchanged. In these difficult times, the key to success is the unity of the Kingdom of Myrtana.
WrittenText_EasternArchipelago_4: Cohesive, united, and with the grace of Innos, we will vanquish the enemy.
WrittenText_Patron_01_1: One of the local anecdotes that has long brightened the faces of weary sailors is the story of a fisherman from the Southern Islands. His name was Kintarou, supposedly in honor of his great-great-grandfather, a fearless sea dog who sailed all waters.
WrittenText_Patron_01_2: Unlike his ancestor, Kintarou never ventured far out to sea. He cast his nets in a nearby bay, waiting for some zander or perch to fall into them. Usually around noon, when the sun started to set, he would stretch out in the hammock on the boat and sip dark beer. He had always believed that with the help of this drink he could not only have a better time, but also catch good fish.
WrittenText_Patron_01_3: One hot day he emptied his beer in one gulp and fell asleep. The wind grew stronger and the rough waves pushed the boat deeper into the sea. Kintarou awoke at the shore of an unknown island. Disoriented, he paced back and forth until he met a local who welcomed him to Archolos and lead him to the Sailor's Retreat.
WrittenText_Patron_01_4: Stories of amazing fish awakened his thirst for adventure. He wanted to catch something big, so the next morning he boarded the local cutter.
WrittenText_Patron_02_1: I am traveling through the deserts of Varant for the third day already...
WrittenText_Patron_02_2: The sun is mercilessly hot, the last oasis is far behind me and I still can't see the next one. I don't know if it was a dream or a reality, but when exhausted I sat down on the hot sand before noon, I saw something extraordinary.
WrittenText_Patron_02_3: At first I thought it was someone from the nomadic people who had been lost in the storm and was now looking for his settlement, and perhaps he could lead me further on, but the closer this strange figure came to me, the more I became convinced that I could look to him in vain for rescue.
WrittenText_Patron_02_4: It was a powerful and stocky man. His sharp look attested to strength and determination. I barely had time to raise my head before he disappeared from the horizon. In the midst of his dark, tangled robes, I saw something bright shining into the distance. It was some kind of weapon, perhaps a sword, that glinted with a strange purple hue.
WrittenText_Patron_02_5: I felt a deep uneasiness, as if a dream phantom haunted me, wanting my doom. I hurriedly sketched the unusual object. I called it the purple nightmare...
WrittenText_Patron_03_1: The island of Khelen hosts the Great Shooting Competition every year. The winner can ask the governor to grant one wish. Young Patrick has long wanted to become a traveler and explore unknown archipelagos. However, he never had enough gold, so he decided to try his hand at the competition. In the port he met Petra, a merchant from the Merchant's Guild, who offered him a solid but small bow. Its advantage was its extraordinary accuracy, the arrows always silently hitting the most sensitive point or the very center of the shield.
WrittenText_Patron_03_2: The merchant assured that she had a lot of experience, contacts and respect in the merchant world. Without hesitation, Patrick made a deal and handed over his last money.
WrittenText_Patron_03_3: The competition was getting closer and Petra was not coming back. He started to ask merchants about her, but none had ever heard of her. The woman became a mystery that kept Patrick awake at night. After a few weeks of waiting, someone dropped off a box marked 'Silent Death'. It turned out that inside was a piece of useless stick bound with string.
WrittenText_Patron_04_1: You will never understand the genius of General Subli... Fortunately, I have been educated by the Fire Mages and I am much smarter than the average soldier of the Myrtanian Army. I can easily catch all the references to the history of magic and the ethos of paladins, which he likes to smuggle in his public speeches.
WrittenText_Patron_04_2: You can only guess how many subtle references and hidden anecdotes one can catch even during one speech of General Subli. Fortunately, this was made possible for me! Anyway, what am I saying! Luck has nothing to do with it! It is not by blind luck that I am able to catch all these nuances, but by years of hard work, education and acquiring knowledge.
WrittenText_Patron_04_3: I hope that you, my dear colleagues, will also experience this clarity of mind one day...
WrittenText_Patron_05_1: There have been many Fire Mages of extraordinary piety, great magical knowledge, or unparalleled prudence, but few can match their achievements with Mikhtar, the Prudent One.
WrittenText_Patron_05_2: Unlike his brethren, he was able to maintain a perfect balance between firmness in spreading the faith and forbearance towards unenlightened. He believed that mages should not frighten and intimidate, but teach and inspire. Hence he commanded great respect even among the Water Mages.
WrittenText_Patron_05_3: He spent many years traveling to the farthest reaches of the world,
WrittenText_Patron_05_4: where he passed on not only his teachings and Innos, but also the basics of history and sciences. During one such adventure, he came into possession of a staff by which he was recognized for many years - the Stars' Judgement. He took that name from a ballad.
WrittenText_Patron_05_5: Unfortunately, the Lord was all too quick to take him in. While his head was still grey, he gave up his spirit by saving a small village from a host of the foul spawn of Beliar. His faith was so strong that his body burned, cleansing the area of all impurity without harming any innocent.
WrittenText_NoMoreGoldMine_2: In order to prepare the mine for more efficient mining and to provide all our employees with the best possible working conditions, the council of the Merchant Guild of Araxos has decided to restructure the mine.
WrittenText_NoMoreGoldMine_3: Due to the ongoing reorganization, the election of a new management and the planned opening of new shafts, all activity at the mine has been suspended indefinitely.
WrittenText_NoMoreGoldMine_4: We will inform everyone about the reopening of the mine through appropriate announcements!
WrittenText_NoMoreGoldMine_6: Council of the Araxos Merchant's Guild
WrittenText_BastianEggs_2: How am I supposed to make scrambled eggs for our guests if you keep forgetting to buy fresh scavenger eggs!
WrittenText_BastianEggs_3: Either get a dozen of those eggs right away, or you can forget about serving our specialty!
WrittenText_VenzelPrisonNote_2: Next time I won't be able to help you anymore and you'll be the one in jail.
WrittenText_SimonHead_1: Don't ask why, but Simon told to relay that he's going to buy 25 mantis heads. I think they are going to organize some game with the guys, but who would know.
WrittenText_SimonHead_2: Anyway, if you just got back from a hunt and have some of that crap on you, Simon will gladly buy it back for full value in gold.
WrittenText_SimonHead_3: In case you didn't know, he's been guarding Cortez's cabin most of the day.
WrittenText_VicenteWing_1: Vicente has apparently come up with some brilliant idea for a device that will keep you from getting parched on sunny days and wet in a downpour. The whole thing is supposed to consist of a long stick and a lightweight but waterproof material.
WrittenText_VicenteWing_2: I tried to talk this idiotic idea out of his head, but he was very stubborn. In the end, he will buy a dozen bloodfly and swamp bloodfly wings each. He will pay full price in gold for each pair of wings.
WrittenText_VicenteWing_3: You can usually find him at our inn.
WrittenText_EinarPlate_2: I will be purchasing 20 pieces of crawler armorplates on an immediate basis.
WrittenText_EinarPlate_3: I am offering full value in gold for each of them.
WrittenText_EinarPlate_4: The goods must be delivered to me at the forge. I also accept split deliveries.
WrittenText_LucasHorn_1: As this year's Shadowbeasts hunting season begins, I encourage all hunters to provide me with horns of the beasts that you manage to hunt. The best of them will decorate the Wolf's Den during the upcoming Feast of Ancestors.
WrittenText_LucasHorn_2: Following Nirka's suggestion from last year, this year you can also bring me the horns of the dragon snapper.
WrittenText_LucasHorn_3: In conclusion, for bringing two of each of the trophy types listed below, you will receive their full value in gold:
WrittenText_LucasHorn_7: I will be accepting trophies at the Wolf's Den, near our inn.
WrittenText_InnosMagic_1: For countless centuries the servants of Innos have battled all creatures of Beliar. In order to stand a chance against disgusting monsters such as orcs and demons, the Lord of Light and Fire has equipped his followers with powerful magic.
WrittenText_InnosMagic_2: This magic comes in two forms. The magic of fire, which is only taught to the priests of Innos, and the magic of light, also known as paladin magic, which can be used by them.
WrittenText_InnosMagic_3: It's well known that fire spells work perfectly in most situations and that they are especially effective against reanimated zombies. However, not many know how powerful paladin spells are when fighting cursed creatures. They seem to literally burn these abominations.
WrittenText_InnosMagic_4: This is how warriors of Innos are able to defeat much larger enemy units. I myself witnessed a few years ago, a small group of paladins clearing the areas near the fortress of Vardhal, when the filth began to plague the surrounding areas.
WrittenText_BorrisNote_1: (most of the content was smudged by water)
WrittenText_BorrisNote_2: ...losing that damn leg cost me my position and the respect of my commanding officer. My good wife, I have no intention of coming home and being a burden to you for the rest of my days.
WrittenText_BorrisNote_3: From what I have heard, you are doing very well in running our business together. From this day the store passes to your exclusive use, deal with it as you see fit.
WrittenText_BorrisNote_4: Forgive me for what I intend to do.
WrittenText_KunoFather_2: I did not expect you to be driven by such petty motives as wanting to seize my family's assets.
WrittenText_KunoFather_3: As everyone is well aware, my sister was not in her right mind in the last days of her life, which her vicious little son took advantage of to change her will.
WrittenText_KunoFather_4: He is an irresponsible man who works against the interests of the kingdom and his political views are simply toxic.
WrittenText_KunoFather_5: I have no intention of watching my parents' wealth being drunk and then seized by incompetent officials.
WrittenText_KunoFather_6: Know that I will go to the king himself to complain about this outrageous decision, and don't think that you will dissuade me with this nonsense about the growing threat from Orcs.
WrittenText_Medicine_1: When was the last time you heard about an advancement in medicine? A new cure, new methods, or insightful studies of the human body?
WrittenText_Medicine_2: Has the majority of society really decided that magical abilities solve all medical issues?
WrittenText_Medicine_3: Maybe this is part of a larger conspiracy? Maybe the Mages want to control us in this way? To keep tabs on us?
WrittenText_Medicine_4: On the other hand... after all, there are too few of them to influence the actions of all the people in the entire kingdom, or even the continent itself! I'm considering a trip to the outskirts of the Kingdom of Myrtana and the villages where these devious mages have not yet planted their seed of untruth.
WrittenText_Medicine_5: The local barbers and medicine men must have some methods of their own for dealing with sickness and wounds. Perhaps in the midst of this primordial medical knowledge I can find something that the mages have been keeping from us...
WrittenText_Paladin01_1: I am dismayed to conclude that I am no different from those I have questioned.
WrittenText_Paladin01_2: When was the last time I accomplished something I wanted for myself? When did I help others because I could or wanted to do so myself? Never! I only follow the orders I receive.
WrittenText_Paladin01_3: Like those unfortunates, I have lost my free will. I have become a tool. It's time to let go of these shackles of lies and commanders. It feels like waking up in a great void, like finally opening my eyes to its boundlessness... I must find the truth on my own. Only one thing is certain - my time in the Order of Paladins is over.
WrittenText_Paladin02_1: All those we have captured say the same thing - they have given themselves over to the service of Beliar, to pursue their own goals and desires. Frighteningly, some of them initially even wanted to fight against injustice, unfavorable judgment, or social divisions.
WrittenText_Paladin02_2: What could have happened that they completely lost themselves in the desire for power, forgetting their original motives. Could the influence of Beliar alone so distort even a good-natured man?  If so, could even one of us paladins be so bent? I must consider this in prayer.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_01_1: On one winter night, the Young Wolf came to the entrance to the cave. He flashed his teeth, throwing a piece of molerat meat on the ground. Warm, still steaming blood poured down its tendons. A pack of cold, hungry wolves eagerly took the gift, and in great haste split the meal for everyone. But the Young Wolf did not take a single bite, for when the light of day poured into the cave, he rushed away.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_01_2: The next night, he came again with yet another chunk of meat, and the wolves accepted the gift with joy, devouring bits by bits and glancing in awe at their saviour.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_01_3: But before the rays of the sunlight shone into the cave, the Young Wolf vanished once more. When on the following night, the animal tried to slip out again, the Large Wolf stood in his way. And so the sunlight revealed all his secrets.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_01_4: The Young Wolf had no silver fur like others. It was of the colour of mud, ragged and marked with scars. His tail was broken, one of his ears was torn. He lacked fangs in his maw and claws on his paws. The pack growled at the misfit with anger. There was no place for him here any more. And so the Large Wolf told the Young Wolf to run away and never return.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_02_1: Many winters passed and the Young Wolf was not coming back. The pack was thinning. Some animals went into the fields, others took refuge in forests. Those who left in the cave, with great fear, watched blazing fires of war on the horizon.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_02_2: The burden of power rested upon the Large Wolf. At first, he pretended to be responsible, but in time, he was leaving the best bits to himself, condemning others to hunger. He also made peace with a Human, whom he appeased for a terrible price.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_02_3: Years later, a pack of beasts broke into the cave. Their fur was as dark as the sky above. Their fiery eyes gazed at the wolves. Jagged but sharp fangs flashed in the darkness like torches.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_02_4: The beasts howled and began the slaughter. Wolves' once silver fur was now marked with blood. The biggest of monsters caught the old Leader. He went blind a long time ago, but he knew the smell well.
WrittenText_VolkerPast_02_5: ‘I will spare you’, hissed the black beast, ‘because thanks to you, I was reborn. And now run and never return.
WrittenText_BurnedJournual_Volker_2: Dearest Elsa! I wanted to write you a letter, but to describe this beautiful town in words, I would need to start writing a book. I’m not a writer myself, so I decided to start this journal. I will send it to you as soon as some ship from the mainland gets to the harbour.
WrittenText_BurnedJournual_Volker_4: A month ago a local entrepreneur Volker hired me to work. It looks like my mutton with vegetables must’ve charmed him. Dad always told me I have a thing for cooking, so I decided to take advantage of it and look, I became a chef!
WrittenText_BurnedJournual_Volker_6: There’s a lot of work, but all in all, I got this offer out of nowhere. Mr. Volker is a hard-working man. Can’t say the same about his bodyguards, though. They look like mere thugs. Lately, I’ve been finding Volker reading some old books and documents. I wonder what they are about.
WrittenText_BurnedJournual_Volker_8: That was terrible! Yesterday evening, Bradlock and Madog dragged some bloodied man to Volker’s room. They treated him like an old bag of turnips! Later they forced him to the back of the mansion. I have no idea what happened to him later, but I fear nothing good.
WrittenText_EveLetter_2: One of those slobs noticed me eavesdropping. He snatched my journal and hid it somewhere. That's why I had to switch over to the letters.
WrittenText_EveLetter_3: The longer I sit here, the more I realize I made a mistake agreeing to this job. I talked to Bernard about leaving, but all he told me was that 'you don't just walk away from Volker'. What did he mean by that? Since the assassination attempt, the boss hasn't left his office even for a second. He only let Bradlock and Susanne in. They were talking about those blue stones again.
WrittenText_EveLetter_4: I don't know why I'm writing all this. Maybe I'm afraid I'll end up like that boy, Norman, and the only thing left of me will be these pages? I wish I'd listened to you, sis.
WrittenText_KunoLetter_2: I cannot be more grateful for the help you have offered me and my wife. Since your intervention, the guardsmen stopped troubling us and the judge told me that I have paid my debt. I know that you didn’t have to risk your good name, especially during such uneasy times. Whenever we will get on our feet, we will return you all the gold with interest.
WrittenText_MorrisLetter_1: In the name of king Rhobar II, for years-long protection over enterprises, invaluable service to citizens, and capturing Ulryk, a traitor who attempted to crumble the foundations of order and safety on the island, I hereby name Mr. Volker the Royal Treasurer. In this respect and with full confidence, I grant him control over the coffers of the town hall. I also promise to do whatever lies in my power to make him the legal owner of the silver mine and the lands that surround it.
WrittenText_Aquamarine_1: You probably thought that this book would contain yet another chilling tale about an adventurer who made it alive from an encounter with a dragon or saved more than one damsel. Unfortunately, this book contains usual information about unusual treasures which you may find in various depths of this world.
WrittenText_Aquamarine_2: No trinket is favoured by women to an extent like a necklace made of polished pearls. Even though limitations in sea transport made this product more valuable than gold, a careful pearl-diver can surely find many of them locked in seashells or buried in the sand.
WrittenText_Aquamarine_3: One merchant, whom I once met on Khorinis, told me a joke that had it not been for royal decrees and properties of the magic ore, he would build himself a house from the latter. This blue, raw material has no equal when it comes to hardness. Magic ore is also particularly rare, so if you happen to stumble upon the deposit, you better keep that information to yourself.
WrittenText_Aquamarine_4: Aquamarines are particularly precious for collectors as well as Water Mages who use them to craft runes of magic. Although this blue mineral appears to be related to the sea, you can find it only in the deepest recesses of the world, often in the company of iron deposits.
WrittenText_Scribe_2: We have repelled another assault. Glory to Jarund! Glory to Volfzack! The brave hearts of our warriors are filled with joy and will to fight. Their swords must be led by Ancestors, indeed. Even I, a mere scribe, can feel their presence!
WrittenText_Scribe_4: Last night, the Wolf Howl proved its use once more, decimating enemy ranks. Commander Vardec said that our provisions shall suffice for a half a year of siege. It is more than enough for Jarund to help us. I can hear the drums again. They are coming.
WrittenText_Scribe_6: Woe to us! Did Ancestors themselves mock us? The moment the king’s soldiers fell back from the gate, the sky bled, spitting out ribbons of fire! The flames poured out on the walls, melting them and turning people to ash!
WrittenText_Scribe_8: How can fire undo stone? What foul spells has our enemy at hand? The flames already engulfed the courtyard and broke into the Great Hall. We are trying to put out the fire, but I see no hope. I barely can breathe anymore.
WrittenText_Scribe_9: So hot. It’s so hot here.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_GargoyleLetter_1: They can see you, but you see them not,
WrittenText_Volfzacke_GargoyleLetter_2: Shadowed figures make your mind blot.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_GargoyleLetter_6: Look behind - they are stone anew.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_GargoyleLetter_7: Don’t you dare to take a nap,
WrittenText_Volfzacke_GargoyleLetter_8: Else you’ll fall into a trap.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_01_1: Just as I once came to this island with Master Periandes, I had to make another pilgrimage after his death. The seed of doubt was planted deep in my heart, and after certain revelations on the swamps, it sprouted. Though I no longer can call myself an archmage, for the sake of the monastery, I shall keep the truth of what I saw there to myself.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_01_2: But my journey was not solely due to a crisis of faith. After all, the current residents of Archolos were not its first, as evidenced by the remarkable structures in the southern marshes.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_01_3: During many weeks I spent travelling, I proved that these ruins are similar in appearance to certain elements of the fortress in the northwest. The resemblance can be found, especially regarding the foundations.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_01_4: It could be true that the stronghold was built many years, if not centuries, before Volfzack. But why, in the end, did the swampfolk abandon their plans to expand the structure? One can assume that the warrior-like people of Archolos simply forced settlers back to the swamp, and carried on the work in their own fashion.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_02_1: The fortress is truly a place like no other on the island. And I don't just mean the dizzying colonnades and vaults that form a unity with the cave complex. Inside the fortress, I encountered a peculiar aura that inexplicably stimulates my senses.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_02_2: Whatever the purpose for which the original inhabitants of Archolos erected the foundations of the fortress, perhaps they felt the same as I felt as I strolled through the endless underground corridors. With the permission of the guards, I set up my study in one of the rooms.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_02_3: Now, it resembles a library, but I hope that in time I will bring here my tools for further research. The Great Hall together with catacombs prove the undoubted craftsmanship of their builders. If the Water Mages had arrived on the island earlier, I would assume that they helped erect this impressive work.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Monastery_02_4: The stone pedestals also seem intriguing. Although today their purpose remains unknown, it is possible that they once served as the focus of great magical power. Perhaps my former brother, Ibeus, could shed more light on them.
WrittenText_HerbList_1: I wouldn't be me if, in such a fascinating place, I didn't do some superficial research into the properties of the local soil. The results, however, exceeded my wildest expectations.
WrittenText_HerbList_2: Although I don't see any plants in the area, the soil at Volfzacke allows a variety of plants to grow, including the extremely demanding healing root. And out of the sunlight! In less than a month, I have grown quite a sizable bush that would normally take as long as six months.
WrittenText_HerbList_3: If only I had more time, I would certainly devote it to more extensive research on the subject. I have to hope that future generations will find a way to grow plants under similar conditions.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_01_1: Although I have travelled the length and breadth of this land, and it would seem... no more surprises in it, I still find places that inspire me to do research. One of them is ... a stronghold in the west of the island called Vardhal.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_01_2: Indeed, a specific aura can be felt in this place. I am also certain that the people who once erected its foundations had some higher purpose. A purpose I'm still trying to understand. Though the guards... from the tomb of their ruler even for a step, I managed to get permission from their commander to conduct further research.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_01_3: I also had a chance to catch a glimpse of the oval platforms Taneris mentioned ... they resemble the platforms I saw on the islands of Khorinis and Laran ... all I had to do was touch the surface of this one here, and I felt a powerful vortex of energy flowing through it.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_01_4: All indications are that the magic that has somehow been accumulated ... has a limited charge. The question now is, can this charge be re-injected into them? What were these strange platforms used for? Indeed, how little we still know about the secret of the greatest gift of the gods!
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_02_1: It seems the purpose of the platforms was to transport objects and people from one place to another. Archmage Periandes said that the magic of teleportation is one of the least stable. Bending time and space is a fascinating subject to which I will devote my following years.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_02_2: Although platforms follow a predefined system, I wonder if this connection can be separated in some way. Perhaps the ability to teleport is bound not to artificially created platforms, but also to places where this power is concentrated?
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_02_3: One such place lies ... south of Vardhal and the other is in the chapel of Adanos in the Silver River basin. I have come up with a theory that the places of power are located in places of significance to the people who once inhabited them. These can be both locations of happy celebrations and those of great tragedies.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_Teleport_02_4: While the High Council looks on my research with doubt, I have no intention of stopping what I have started. I have to create appropriate runes to assign to the various places of power. Archmage Modares would know plenty about them. Unfortunately, the Lord had a different plan for him.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_01_1: About time, we are inside. One more night spent near those wolves, and I wouldn’t sleep a wink.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_01_2: The Grand Hall is larger than we expected. It could easily store that royal galleon I saw in the harbour. Pity that we found no chests of gold on the doorstep.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_01_3: Sevinus and I scouted the area. It’s dark and bloody wet everywhere we go. I don’t know how I managed to light this torch. Ioris was more clever, though. She used a spell she bought on the market. Kerran went his own way, as he always does. I hope he won’t get himself into trouble.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_01_4: For now, I see shit, but in time our eyes should adjust to the darkness. We set up camp near some statues. Tomorrow things should be better.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_02_1: I slept surprisingly well, and luckily, those nightmares haunted me no more. All my bones are hurting, though. In time, I will have to get used to this cold.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_02_2: We had some miserable mush for breakfast. The locals call it a ‘fisherman’s cauldron’. I don’t know what the innkeeper added into his pot, but on Khorinis they serve better food than in this rathole.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_02_3: Sevinus said some bullshit that the statues were placed differently yesterday. The guy is afraid, but it’s no wonder why. He stood behind the counter and sold trash for most of his life.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_02_4: Kerran picked up all the snares he set up for the night. It looks like not even rats live here. On one hand, it can be a good thing. On the other, we have to save provisions for the journey home.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_03_1: Had it not been for Ioris, we would be walking in circles another day, or a night. Who knows what time we have right now. The girl went through several pages of this old book and led us to the library! It made a big impression on her and Kerran, but I would rather see in my bag something more than a few coins and a rusty chalice.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_03_2: We stopped here for a while. The dry wood supplies are about to end, so Kerran burned some of those old books instead. Ioris complained about it, but we couldn’t read anything from them anyway.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_03_3: Things are getting worse with Sevinus. He’s talking nonsense about some shadows and keeps walking from one room to another. Just in case, I took from him the key to the fortress. I'd better keep an eye on it.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_04_1: Finally, fortune smiled on us. One of the corridors led us to the chest full of trinkets.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_04_2: I had a fight with Kerran. The guy demanded an additional reward for showing us the direction to the treasure chamber. He forgot though that it was me who found this place. I made sure that each of us got equally rewarded.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_04_3: I took a golden sword and a dagger, Ioris got a chest with crystals and some scrolls, and Kerran grabbed a belt, necklace, and some rings. There are two bags of gold left for Sevinus, but he disappeared somewhere. Not that it surprises me much.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_05_1: We found Sevinus, or should I say, whatever’s left of him. What could have happened to this poor fellow? Ioris thinks that Kerran got rid of him and wanted to take his share of the treasure, but I don’t believe that. I didn’t let him out of my sight! I've been telling Sevinus to be careful on the way back from the town. Maybe someone followed him? We buried him and went to one of the further chambers, where we set up another camp.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_05_2: Everyone’s sad and tired, but we can’t give up now. Ioris says she knows the way to the tomb, but all she does is stare at those books. I hope she comes up with something smart. Kerran set up snares and lit torches for the night. I told him to take a rest. I will stand on watch tonight. There's no chance I'll get any sleep after all this.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_05_3: Is that statue staring at me, or am I going crazy?
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_06_2: Yesterday, they stormed our camp when I took a nap. Torches did their job, but ten more of them came. Ioris got wounded, and it doesn’t look good. We have to get the shit out to another chamber.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_06_3: Those bastards don’t give up, but Kerran holds the door. Ioris wants me to use a healing spell on her, BUT I HAVE NO BLOODY CLUE HOW TO DO IT!!
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_06_4: It was a mistake to come here. Now, we’re all going to die like a bunch of losers and nobody will even know about it.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_07_1: I snapped and ran like a bloody coward when Ioris died in my arms. Kerran wouldn't have made it anyway. Forgive me.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_07_2: I twisted my leg and I see shit in this shithole. What’s worse, the key slipped away somewhere. I’m crawling like a meatbug waiting until something or someone crushed me to a pulp.
WrittenText_Volfzacke_List_07_3: I can hear someone’s steps. Maybe that’s Kerran? Thank god I have this sword with me. If it’s one of those undead bastards, before I die, I swear I’ll make sure it dies again!
WrittenText_PeaceKeeper_2: Thus came the night, darker and longer than any other before. The sea angered, oars moved, horns howled, and drums played a measured song. The Chief of the North looked with scorn at the King of the South and challenged him. And the war soon enveloped the blessed land. The clash of iron was carried grimly across fields and forests, hills and valleys, and the promise of the hard-fought peace was broken.
WrittenText_PeaceKeeper_3: Two warlords shook the very foundations of Arc-Holos, calling upon ancestral spirits to stand by their side.
WrittenText_PeaceKeeper_4: But only the wind answered them. Holding anger and depravity in their hearts, the two rivals waged a bloody war that took young and old, poor and rich alike.
WrittenText_PeaceKeeper_5: Then the Uniter raised an unblemished blade in the sky and cut the chains of the feud, turning the warring lords back to the path of righteousness. And so, He brought balance through the Peacemaker, and as long as He wielded it, no one dared to question His will. Thus, even the fiercest of hearts stopped their men and humbly gave themselves to the justice of He-Who-Wields-The-Power-Of-The-Lord.
WrittenText_OldLaw_1: Without tradition, all our laws would be for nothing. Is it not just a set of prohibitions and orders invented by one and imposed on another? Who has enough wisdom in his head to decide about everything in the world? After all, they need to be regularly corrected and adjusted, because the world is changing every day. An example of such development of laws based on tradition is the right to duel and the right to honorable weapons.
WrittenText_OldLaw_2: In olden times any convicted person could claim to fight in a duel to prove his innocence. This meant that many skilled swordsmen could never be convicted and could do as they pleased.
WrittenText_OldLaw_3: On the other hand, to send a noble or a guard to prison was also undignified.
WrittenText_OldLaw_4: The right to honorable arms changed that. If convict was known and respected, he could be allowed own weapons while in prison. It indicated that they were not being stripped of former merits and that fellow citizens still had confidence in them.
WrittenText_OldLaw_5: This law has been applied less and less, and it is now considered a personal protest by the judge about the trail's outcome.
WrittenText_VolkerWaterCircle_1: It is with great regret that I write these words, but by a joint decision of the full Monastery Council meeting, we have decided to end our partnership.
WrittenText_VolkerWaterCircle_2: Despite your sincere and enlightened intentions, many members of our association have reservations about some of your methods and the main structure of your activities.
WrittenText_VolkerWaterCircle_3: However, we believe that your commitment to our great island is admirable and we trust that you will be able to bring much good to it. We will watch your actions, raise prayers for your intentions and wish you perseverance in your faith in our Lord.
WrittenText_VolkerWaterCircle_4: We also ask that you keep everything you have learned so far in strict confidence.
WrittenText_LostPatrons_1: Paladins who fell during the Battle of Vardhal:
WrittenText_LostPatrons_15: For their dedication to Myrtana, they will never be forgotten!
WrittenText_KesselRaport_4: General Comments - Despite using a variety of methods to extract information, the prisoner has still not revealed anything useful. He seems most susceptible to being waterboarded and burned with a glowing rod, but this mostly evokes very private and traumatic memories. He mentions something about his father's smithy several times in his hallucinations, it seems he blames himself for his father's death.
WrittenText_KesselRaport_5: Either this bald bastard is damn hard to crack, or he really has no idea about the mutineers organization. Either way, the boss's orders are clear - interrogate until he confesses to something. At least I'll be able to try out Bradlock's new toys on him.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_4: LOCATION: Abandoned human campfires, small caves, narrow passages
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_5: ADVICE: Often circle around prey, do not allow yourself to be surrounded.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_9: LOCATION: Abandoned human campfires, small caves, narrow passages
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_10: ADVICE: Often circle around prey, do not allow yourself to be surrounded.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_15: LOCATION: Abandoned human campfires, small caves, narrow passages
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_16: ADVICE: Often circle around prey, do not allow yourself to be surrounded.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOBLIN_22: ADVICE: They live in smaller groups than other goblins - easier to lure out one at a time.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_WOLF_5: ADVICE: When they are far from an opponent, they try to jump towards them - they are then easy to evade.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_WOLF_11: ADVICE: When they are far from the enemy, they try to jump towards them - they are then easy to evade.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_WOLF_16: ADVICE: They bite very hard and occur in packs - recommended weakening the group from a distance.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_WOLF_20: LOCATION: In the vicinity of orc patrols. On Archolos - None
WrittenText_BESTIARY_WOLF_21: ADVICE: Run away - there must be orcs nearby! Not to be confused with wargs!
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SCAVENGER_5: ADVICE: Easy to hunt but pecks hard - better not to get pecked first.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SCAVENGER_11: ADVICE: Tougher than its appearance suggests. They peck very hard, but are easy to lure out individually.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TROLL_5: ADVICE: If the fist doesn't kill you, the fall will. Prepare a free fall potion! Trolls are very slow - take advantage of that!
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TROLL_11: ADVICE: Smaller and weaker, but not to be underestimated under any circumstances. They can hurl a human just as far as the other trolls.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TROLL_16: LOCATION: Large caves in mountainous terrain
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TROLL_17: ADVICE: Cave trolls are very family oriented and extremely protective of their young. Under no circumstances should you enter their lair!
WrittenText_BESTIARY_MINECRAWLER_5: ADVICE: Edge weapons are great against their long and thin limbs. The most important thing is not to get pinned to the cave wall.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_MINECRAWLER_11: ADVICE: Due to their green color they are perfectly camouflaged among the grass - be careful.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_MINECRAWLER_17: ADVICE: Very dangerous, often other crawler subspecies live near them.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_MINECRAWLER_23: ADVICE: They fire acid from mandibles - best to step to the side.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_HARPIE_5: ADVICE: Often fly high above the opponent's head during combat. A strong gust of wind can damage their wings.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_HARPIE_11: ADVICE: Much tougher and more dangerous than ordinary harpies. They often fly high above their opponent's head during combat. A strong gust of wind can damage their wings.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SHADOWBEAST_4: LOCATION: Small caves, dark woods, isolated rock ledges
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SHADOWBEAST_5: ADVICE: Run. I say this in all seriousness, run. These beasts can rip a man apart with a single blow. They are fast and tough, and no one has yet found an effective way to fight them. When they hunt, they pay no heed to their wounds and strike incessantly with their powerful paws. The only thing that can help you is to try to surprise them while they are sleeping. Try to sneak up and strike the first blow. The rest will be in Innos' hands.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SHADOWBEAST_10: LOCATION: Dark caverns with an unholy past
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SHADOWBEAST_11: ADVICE: One of the few creatures capable of defeating a living shadowbeast. As a skeleton, it is vulnerable to blunt weapons and wind spells, but even more resistant to projectiles, edge weapons, and magic. Its bony claws are capable of penetrating the heaviest armor. They don't seem to care about the damage they suffer.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_BEAR_5: ADVICE: Don't get hit. Bears are not as resistant to injury as they may seem, but a single blow from their paw can be fatal.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_BEAR_11: ADVICE: The mass of these beasts makes them virtually unresponsive to the damage they receive. Their thick skin makes them resistant to even extremely powerful hits.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SWAMPSHARK_5: ADVICE: Slow creatures that crawl on the ground as they move, making them easy to miss in deeper water. Their great body mass and slimy, tough skin give them great protection and cause them to attack enemies without reacting to the damage they receive. Their large mouths literally crush their prey as they grasp them.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SWAMPSHARK_10: ADVICE: Even larger and more dangerous than their swamp counterparts. Due to their size, color and feeding location, they are much easier to spot. During combat they pay no attention to the damage they receive and constantly try to crush their prey with their powerful maw.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_RATS_6: ADVICE: Overgrown rodent - often chooses to feed on found carrion instead of fighting, even of its own kind.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_RATS_11: ADVICE: Looks like a cross between a molerat and a giant rat. Due to its fat body it moves and fights like the former.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_RATS_16: ADVICE: Much larger than other rat species, it is also much more resistant to damage. Like other rats, it will often choose carrion over battle.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GIANTBUG_6: ADVICE: Despite their sizable size, they are not very hardy. They often feed in larger groups, but it is very easy to lure out individuals who are virtually defenseless when charging.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GIANTBUG_11: LOCATION: Forests, cultivated fields near forests.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GIANTBUG_12: ADVICE: In contrast to field specimens, they are much tougher and can sting really hard. Their dark carapaces camouflage them perfectly in dark thickets. You might not even notice them at night!
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SNAPPERS_5: ADVICE: They always hunt in packs. They approach prey slowly at first, but once they attack, it is hard to escape. It's best to dodge their charge and attack their back.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SNAPPERS_9: LOCATION: Mountain areas, but can adapt to any
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SNAPPERS_11: groups, but they are more dangerous. Fight them like their smaller cousins.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SNAPPERS_16: LOCATION: Mountain areas, but can hunt in any
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SNAPPERS_17: ADVICE: These beasts can shred even a heavily armored warrior. Main weakness is their movements, a skilled swordsman can evade their attack. The Fist of Wind spell can break their bones, but most attempts end in death.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOLEMS_6: ADVICE: If you can avoid it, do so. Most golems are adamant about guarding their territory - when their peace is not disturbed, they do not engage in combat. If you do have to fight one, prepare a melee weapon at all costs - other weapons are practically ineffective. A potion of free fall will be an additional advantage - Golems can throw their opponents many meters away.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_GOLEMS_12: ADVICE: Slightly weaker than their stone counterparts, but just as dangerous. The behaviors of both species are very similar, making the tactics for fighting them also not different. Their susceptibility to fire is difficult to exploit due to their considerable protection against magic - it's best to prepare very strong fire spells. At all costs avoid fighting in water - golems, due to their mass and size, simply move on the bottom and can still crush with their powerful fists.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SKELETONS_1: TYPE OF DAMAGE: Edge, Blunt, Projectiles
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SKELETONS_5: ADVICE: Most skeletons use the type of weapon they used when they were alive. This is why you can find all kinds of skeletons - warriors, archers and crossbowmen. Their bones are extremely difficult to damage with a blade or an arrow, but a solid blow, a fist of wind, or a fall from a height can easily turn them into a pile of dust.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_SKELETONS_6: Despite the fragility of their bodies, every blow from these cursed creatures is extremely powerful. Due to their location, they often attack in groups - which makes them even more dangerous opponents.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_BOAR_5: ADVICE: Despite appearances, they are more likely to strike with their massive head than with their fangs - it is best to prepare your armor for blunt damage and evade them like wolves.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_BAT_6: ADVICE: They sleep most of the day, hanging head down. When awakened, they jump down on their opponent, then rise into the air and attack by circling above their head. When asleep, they are easily avoided by sneaking under their resting place. Like Harpies, their wings are easily damaged by a gust of wind.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TURTLE_4: LOCATION: Wetlands, near bodies of water
WrittenText_BESTIARY_TURTLE_5: ADVICE: The thick shells on their backs make them unresponsive to blows and they constantly cut the legs of their attackers with extremely sharp teeth. They move very slowly - use this to your advantage.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_CRAB_5: ADVICE: Their thick armor makes them unresponsive to inflicted blows and they do not stop attacking with their pincers.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_ZOMBIE_5: ADVICE: Extremely slow, but very tough and resistant to damage. Despite their decaying bodies, they do not react to blows dealt to them. Even a single jerk from these tortured creatures can kill a human. Many of them lie in wait, pretending to be dead, in order to attack the unsuspecting wanderer by surprise.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_MOLERAT_5: ADVICE: Their fat bodies offer little protection, but do not underestimate them - molerats, especially in groups, can be deadly.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_4: LOCATION: Beaches, rivers and bodies of water.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_5: ADVICE: Despite their large size, they are not very tough. The most dangerous are their charges and jumps - thanks to their long body and tail they can quickly change the distance between themselves and their prey.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_9: LOCATION: Swamps, canals, near bodies of water
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_10: ADVICE: Less tough than the swamp lizard, but far more aggressive and dangerous - their razor-sharp fangs can do a lot of damage.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_15: ADVICE: Much more durable than their normal counterpart. Hard scales protect them best from physical damage.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LIZARD_21: ADVICE: Each of their bites sets the victim's skin on fire, causing even more severe wounds. They fight like other lizards and often travel in groups, making them a formidable challenge even for experienced warriors.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_Bloodfly_4: LOCATION: Glades, near bodies of water
WrittenText_BESTIARY_Bloodfly_5: ADVICE: Keep a higher position - step on a small stone or provoke it to fly up to the hill you are standing on. Avoid high ledges - in the confusion you may fall down with the Bloodfly, and only they can fly.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_Bloodfly_10: LOCATION: Rivers and other bodies of water.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_Bloodfly_11: ADVICE: They fight exactly like normal bloodflies, the only difference is that they have more stamina and a sharper stinger.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_Bloodfly_16: ADVICE: They are quite tough for their small size. In contrast to other bloodflies, they prefer spitting acid and only attack with their stinger when the opponent is very close.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LURKER_4: LOCATION: Beaches, rivers and bodies of water
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LURKER_5: ADVICE: Their stride is very sluggish, but they can attack with their paws from very far away. They usually circle their opponent to strike a blow from the side. They often feed in groups and are then extremely dangerous - when one individual occupies the attention of the prey, the other immediately proceeds to attack.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_LURKER_10: ADVICE: They live in much smaller groups than their normal counterparts, but despite this, they use very similar fighting tactics. Due to their environment, they are much more resilient and can hit extremely hard with their paws used for swimming.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_DRONE_5: ADVICE: Best killed from a distance - as they die, they emit a poisonous gas around them that can lead to the death of the person inhaling it. They fight by spitting toxic venom at a very short distance, so in most cases they try to get as close to their attacker as possible.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_DRONE_10: ADVICE: Smaller and less threatening than their swamp cousins, but their post-mortem gas can still be deadly. Especially dangerous in groups though they usually travel alone.
WrittenText_BESTIARY_FROGMAN_5: ADVICE: Despite their large size, their thin skin and meager armor make them vulnerable to damage. However, they are not to be underestimated as they can hit pretty hard down with their big, spiky mace.
WrittenText_Bounty_Slippy_1: Another series of assaults have been reported in the town harbour. From what is known, they have been conducted by a pickpocket known as ‘Slickhand’. The man gravely wounded several guardsmen and is currently on the run.
WrittenText_Bounty_Slippy_2: Slickhand has been seen recently in the Slum area.
