WrittenText_Bounty_Slippy_3: A reward of 100 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who carries out the death sentence on this felon. The bounty can be received from guardsman Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Lurker_1: People of Silbach claim to have seen a body in the water near Lurkers’ Coast. Eyewitnesses claim to have heard screams and saw a struggle, but when they got to the place, the felon escaped.
WrittenText_Bounty_Lurker_2: The man who commited the crime is dressed in pirate clothes and has been spotted behind the waterfall near Lurkers’ Coast.
WrittenText_Bounty_Lurker_3: A reward of 150 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who carries out the death sentence on this felon. The bounty can be received from guardsman Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_MadCutter_1: Woodcutters from the area near Wolf’s Den are warning against taking lone journeys through the road between their camp and Valerio’s Vineyard. A madman with an axe has been seen there several times, attacking travellers.
WrittenText_Bounty_MadCutter_2: A reward of 150 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who carries out the death sentence on this felon. The bounty can be received from guardsman Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_COLLECTOR_1: Roderich denies rumours that members of the City Guard were ordered to collect tolls from people who travel the roads on Archolos. All the imposters are to face the consequences of the highest possible punishment.
WrittenText_Bounty_COLLECTOR_2: One of such Toll Collectors has been spotted south of Silbach near the wooden bridge.
WrittenText_Bounty_COLLECTOR_3: A reward of 200 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who carries out the death sentence on this felon. The bounty can be received from guardsman Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Sewers_1: All citizens of the city are advised to exercise caution when in the vicinity of sewer entrances. The city guard has received numerous reports of thefts and extremely vicious beatings.
WrittenText_Bounty_Sewers_2: According to witness statements, the thugs commit crimes on the city streets, then return to the sewers and cut off the escape route by blocking the sewer entrances.
WrittenText_Bounty_Sewers_3: There is a reward of 250 gold pieces for the execution of the death sentence, to be collected from the guard Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Novize_1: Fire Mages are saddened to learn of a terrible betrayal by one of their charges - a young novice, in a fit of anger, burned several holy books and then left the rectory with a chest full of magical scrolls.
WrittenText_Bounty_Novize_2: Members of the pursuit claim to have lost the culprit near the canyon between the city and Bodowin's workshop.
WrittenText_Bounty_Novize_3: The only just punishment for such a heinous desecration is death, so the person who carries out the sentence will receive a reward of 300 gold pieces from Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Frost_1: The residents of Silbach and Rita's vineyard complain about an aggressive Nordmarian. He has been caught several times stealing sheep and starting fights. The man is extremely strong and aggressive. During the last attempt to detain him, he injured one of the guards.
WrittenText_Bounty_Frost_2: He was last seen near the waterfall on the bridge between Silbach and Rita's vineyard.
WrittenText_Bounty_Frost_3: There is a reward of 300 gold pieces for the execution of the death sentence, to be collected from the guard Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_HYENA_1: Appalled residents of Silbach report that graves in their local cemetery have been dug up. Apparently, the perpetrator regularly returns to the cemetery and robs individual, even fresh graves.
WrittenText_Bounty_HYENA_2: Due to his agility and appearance only at night, the locals nicknamed him the Hyena.
WrittenText_Bounty_HYENA_3: There is a reward of 300 gold pieces for the execution of the death sentence, which can be collected from the guard Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Widow_1: The City Council warns all residents of Old Town against the thief and alleged murderer, who most likely escaped from another island and is now impersonating a rich townswoman.
WrittenText_Bounty_Widow_2: Caution is advised especially for those living alone in Old Town and those without hired security.
WrittenText_Bounty_Widow_3: The woman was last seen dressed as a citizen near the main entrance to City Hall Square.
WrittenText_Bounty_Widow_4: There is a reward of 400 gold pieces for carrying out the death sentence, to be collected from the Oktava guard.
WrittenText_Bounty_Puma_1: The guard warns of a Southerner who travels around the island with his puma. The man, for a hefty fee, has been performing various, supposedly magical, tricks with his animal.
WrittenText_Bounty_Puma_2: During the last such performance 2 citizens died as a result of numerous injuries inflicted by the beast. The man fled the scene of the crime and was last seen on the beaches of the Amber Coast.
WrittenText_Bounty_Puma_3: A reward of 500 gold pieces is provided for the execution of the death sentence, to be collected from Oktav's guard.
WrittenText_Bounty_Prophet_1: Dear citizens of Archolos, we wholeheartedly warn you against any contact with the individual called 'The Prophet'.
WrittenText_Bounty_Prophet_2: This man propounds theories inconsistent with both the teachings of Adanos and Innos himself. He poisons the minds of the good citizens of our city with his words.
WrittenText_Bounty_Prophet_3: Most of his followers are common criminals, swindlers and troublemakers. Most of them can be found in various corners of the harbor, where they spread their lies.
WrittenText_Bounty_Prophet_4: There is a reward of 500 gold pieces for the execution of the death sentence, which can be collected from the guard Oktav.
WrittenText_Bounty_Havdan_1: The city guard is looking for a skilled bounty hunter with extraordinary combat skills.
WrittenText_Bounty_Havdan_2: A man named Havdan has been sentenced to death for crimes that are state secrets.
WrittenText_Bounty_Havdan_3: The man was recently spotted near the moat between the city's east gate and the Amber Coast.
WrittenText_Bounty_Havdan_4: Extreme caution is advised, as this individual is extremely dangerous and very well armed.
WrittenText_Bounty_Havdan_5: There is a reward of 600 gold pieces for the execution of the death sentence, to be collected from the Oktava guard.
WrittenText_Bounty_Boar_1: Last week Valerio's vineyard experienced an attack by a band of wild boars on the grape plantations.
WrittenText_Bounty_Boar_2: The farmers managed to fend off most of the beasts, but one of them, despite receiving numerous injuries, managed to escape.
WrittenText_Bounty_Boar_3: There is a reward of 100 gold pieces for getting rid of this wounded animal, which can be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Scavenger_1: Merchant Guild runners inform about the appearance of unusual species of scavengers on the island of Archolos. It is said that the wounds of those beasts cause burns.
WrittenText_Bounty_Scavenger_2: One of such animals has been spotted recently near the abandoned huts at the southwestern gate.
WrittenText_Bounty_Scavenger_3: A reward of 150 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who kills the beast. The bounty can be received from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Molerat_1: Merchants travelling between the town and Valerio’s Vineyard noticed an increasing population of molerats which have become more aggressive.
WrittenText_Bounty_Molerat_2: Travellers claim that amongst a group of these animals, a particularly large beast has been spotted. They call him a ‘Fatty’.
WrittenText_Bounty_Molerat_3: A reward of 150 gold pieces is hereby offered to anyone who kills the beast. The bounty can be received from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Crab_1: Guard's on the city walls are sending reports of an overgrown crab that has begun feeding near an apple tree just outside the city moat, halfway between the gates.
WrittenText_Bounty_Crab_2: Farmers working in nearby fields warn that the creature is even preying on nearby field raiders.
WrittenText_Bounty_Crab_3: There is a reward of 200 gold pieces for getting rid of this monster, to be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Bat_1: Recently, there have been rumors of a large winged monster in the sewers, drinking the blood of its victims. Even if the wounds are not fatal, it threatens to spread dangerous diseases through the city.
WrittenText_Bounty_Bat_2: Although the sewers are not meant to be visited by citizens according to current regulations, the Merchant Guild has decided to fund a solution to this problem.
WrittenText_Bounty_Bat_3: The beast was last seen on the lower floor of the sewers, near a breach in the wall.
WrittenText_Bounty_Bat_4: A reward of 250 gold is provided for getting rid of it, to be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_IceWolf_1: Fishermen on the Amber Coast report an extremely unusual find - several crates carrying animals from distant lands have drifted to shore near their camp.
WrittenText_Bounty_IceWolf_2: Fishermen saw the white animals get out of the damaged cages and move inland. They can most likely still be found near the beach.
WrittenText_Bounty_IceWolf_3: The Merchant's Guild provides a reward of 200 gold pieces for getting rid of these mysterious beasts, to be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_WhiteBear_1: According to the local beekeepers, a very unusual bear has started to appear in the valley between their apiaries and the Merchant's Guild mine - its fur is white and it seems to be bigger than its brown counterparts.
WrittenText_Bounty_WhiteBear_2: The beast poses a threat to both beekeepers and the transport of goods from the mines, so there is a reward of 300 gold pieces for hunting it, which can be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_ShadowBeast_1: The travelers warn of a shadowbeast that has taken a liking to the path under the signal tower leading towards Wolf's Den.
WrittenText_Bounty_ShadowBeast_2: The creature sleeps most of the time, but you should be extremely careful around it.
WrittenText_Bounty_ShadowBeast_3: There is a reward of 300 gold pieces for getting rid of this beast, which can be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Rat_1: Inhabitants of many parts of the city are complaining about a new kind of rat that is starting to multiply in the sewers. The bite of these pests has proven fatal in many cases.
WrittenText_Bounty_Rat_2: The rodents are believed to feed deep in the sewer corridors and are extremely dangerous, especially in a larger group.
WrittenText_Bounty_Rat_3: For getting rid of all the harmful beasts, the Merchant's Guild provides a reward of 450 gold pieces, to be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_GOLEM_1: The Water Mages from the monastery report a strange construct of magical origin that has appeared in the monastery. The creature is most likely immune to magic, so the assistance of an outside hunter will be required in this matter.
WrittenText_Bounty_GOLEM_2: Entry to the monastery will be provided to anyone willing to take on this challenge. The creature was last seen in a cave on the rock shelves behind the monastery graveyard.
WrittenText_Bounty_GOLEM_3: For the slaughter of this monstrosity, the Water Mages have provided a reward of 500 gold pieces, which will be paid by hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_Troll_1: City guards on routine patrols near the city's western gate have spotted a large herd of trolls that have settled in the forest above the underground passage leading towards the Araxos mines.
WrittenText_Bounty_Troll_2: The beasts seem to have a different coloration than the other trolls on the island, so extreme caution is advised.
WrittenText_Bounty_Troll_3: The person who manages to get rid of all the trolls will receive a reward of 500 gold pieces, to be collected from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_FireWaran_1: As ridiculous as this information may sound, beekeepers claim that dragons have settled near the burnt mill.
WrittenText_Bounty_FireWaran_2: News from travelers seems to confirm the presence of these ancient beasts. The area smells of sulfur, flames can be seen bursting from behind huts, and several burnt animal bodies have been found in the area.
WrittenText_Bounty_FireWaran_3: The hunter who manages to explain these strange incidents and get rid of the beasts, if any, will receive a reward of 600 gold pieces directly from hunter Garos.
WrittenText_Bounty_ForestBug_1: The farmers of Silbach warn against approaching the farmlands outside the village walls. A disturbing beast has appeared on one of them and taken the entire field for itself.
WrittenText_Bounty_ForestBug_2: For your own safety, it is forbidden to work on the field at the entrance to the dark forest.
WrittenText_Bounty_ForestBug_3: There will be a reward of 100 gold pieces for the volunteer who gets rid of the beast, to be collected from Albyn.
WrittenText_StingsDrinking_1: There is much truth in the statement that what is normally poisonous, in small quantities and properly prepared, can have positive effects.
WrittenText_StingsDrinking_2: This is exactly the case when it comes to bloodfly stings. These flying insects can be extremely dangerous with their sharp stingers, filled with poison. More than one traveler has learned that an untreated bite can be fatal.
WrittenText_StingsDrinking_3: However, not all of the substance in the sting is dangerous. If you break it in half vigorously, you can drink all the liquid in its back part with a quick sip.
WrittenText_StingsDrinking_4: Research has shown that only the secretion closest to the stinger gains lethal properties through a complex process of  'ripening' of the poison inside the body of the flying killer. The drinkable liquid, however, has amazing healing properties. Even a single dose can bring any warrior back to his feet.
WrittenText_StingsDrinking_5: Unfortunately, with each dose, the body becomes resistant to the positive effects of the poison and, after some time, the consumption of the stinging secretion may become completely ineffective. However, many hunters point out that along with the immunity, the overall condition of the body also improves, which is a plus for their use.
WrittenText_MandiblesDrinking_1: Many powerful mages have studied crawlers to learn the secrets hidden in the secretions from their mandibles. Although the cause of its properties has yet to be discovered, let alone distilled into safe and effective potions, one can still hear of mages regularly ingesting the contents of the mandibles.
WrittenText_MandiblesDrinking_2: The proper opening of the mandibles, so that the liquids from the two compartments do not combine with each other, allows them to be consumed in complete safety. These fluids are supposed to immediately and fully regenerate the mage's spiritual powers.
WrittenText_MandiblesDrinking_3: There are also reports of extremely rare side effects such as hallucinations and obsessive disorders, but if research is to be believed, these only occur in extreme cases when the secretion is combined with prolonged exposure to other stimulants.
WrittenText_MandiblesDrinking_4: Unfortunately, as with bloodfly stingers, the effect of the mandibles also has its limitations - after repeated use, the body slowly begins to develop an immunity and further consumption of the secretion seems to have no effect. However, many mages report that with the increase in immunity to the stinger, the overall magical potential increases.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Mili: The welfare of our great city is not alien to you? Then don't hesitate and join the ranks of the city guard today!
Each guard can count on free training in the skills required for his service.
Our trainers specialize in fighting with melee weapons and crossbow shooting, but they will also gladly show you how to increase your strength and dexterity.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Arax: If you want great adventures and a full purse, then the Merchant's Guild is the place for you!
All our runners, trackers and mercenaries receive free training, directly related to their tasks.
In our ranks you will meet the strongest and most skilful people on the island, as well as masters of melee weapons and bows.
Please note that according to the latest municipal regulations only citizens of City of Archolos can join the Merchant Guild.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Norm: Do you dream of a career among Volker's mercenaries, but you're not sure of your decision yet?
For a very attractive price you can go through the standard training of a bodyguard and work on your strength, dexterity, bow and crossbow shooting, and fighting with all kinds of melee weapons.
If you are still reading this notice, visit Norman as soon as possible, stationed between Volker's mansion and the marketplace. He is the perfect teacher for any beginner or intermediate.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Odga: Blacksmith Odgar welcomes all the scrawny men who would like to gain some strength.
You won't learn as much about physical strength from anyone else as from the city blacksmith.
If you are interested, visit the smithy in the artisans' district.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Alla: Hunter Allan, Frida's employee, invites all beginners and intermediate marksmen to take lessons in dexterity, crossbow shooting and obtaining trophies.
During the day he can be found outside his mistress's workshop on the marketplace. While you're there, don't forget to get the right crossbow and bolts from her!
With the right training and weapons in your hands, you'll never have to fear wandering through the woods alone again!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Nirk: Is hunting career on your mind?
Learn from one of the greatest marksmen in the history of the island!
Although retired, Nirka is happy to pass on some of his knowledge to anyone interested.
Lessons include dexterity development and archery.
Don't waste any time and head to his house between the marketplace and the museum in City of Archolos.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Dack: Do you have a passion for resource extraction?

Dack, the head of the shipyard, offers training in mining and logging for a fee. This long-standing expert knows everything there is to know about extracting high quality raw materials and preparing them for further processing.
Don't waste time and valuable resources, learn how to use them effectively and make your own fortune!
During the day, Dack resides in the office of the city shipyard, in the northeastern part of the harbor.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Training_Patr: Information for all who seek magical knowledge and wish to dedicate their lives to the service of Adanos!
The Water Mage, Patracjan, gives daily lectures on the development of magical potential, and will be happy to point out the proper path to anyone willing to accept these lessons.
Those wishing to attend are asked to come to the shrine of the Water Mages in the southern part of harbor in the City of Archolos.

WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_Trade_14: Owning stalls requires seperate permits. The main place for them is the Marketplace.

WrittenText_NewsBoard_OldCity_Trade_6: No trading is allowed in  Old Town without registration at the City Hall.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_House_01: We regret to inform you that one of the citizens of the Old Town, whose name should not be mentioned here, has committed crimes that threaten the stability of our great kingdom.
The court has ordered that he be sentenced to exile in the Valley of Mines to work off all the damage he has done and to set an example to other potential criminals.

All of the convict's property has been confiscated, and his house in the Old Town will be put up for auction, which will take place in the near future. Exact information will be posted on the boards in the near future.
Anyone interested in viewing the building is invited to the vicinity of Ernesto's Hostelry, in Old Town.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_SaltMine: (The whole notice appears to be new, but at the same time it is painted with a big X to show that it is no longer valid)
Lewko is looking for decent, conscientious people with reasonable financial requirements to undertake additional guarding at the Royal Salt Mine.
The work consists in controlling the work of miners, clearing new shafts of any dangers, as well as many other minor tasks.
Anyone interested is welcome to visit the mine boss's office near the bridge to the Water Mage Monastery.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Londram_: It is with great regret that we inform you of the terrible news that has recently reached us - the island of Londram has fallen. Reports are unanimous - at this moment everything points to an orc attack.
However, there is no need to worry - the island of Archolos is completely safe.

Therefore we encourage all volunteers to enlist in the army and head to the front. This is your opportunity to explore the world and provide the rest of the Kingdom of Myrtana with the security we can experience here.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Valley_2: If you know anything about mining and dream of making a fortune, then apply now at the nearest recruitment point!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Valley_3: Additionally, every volunteer will be exempted from military service for life.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Sewers_1: It is with sadness that we report more reported disappearances in and around the sewers. We have also received numerous reports of aggressive creatures spotted in the sewers. Unless these reports are confirmed, we strongly advise you not to check it on your own. The appropriate authorities are already working on solving the problem.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Sewers_2: At the same time, we would like to remind you that it is absolutely forbidden to live in the sewer area - any such attempts will result in immediate expulsion from the city.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Sewers_3: For the convenience of residents, we have provided below a list of entrances to the sewers, so that you can easily avoid them:
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Sewers_5: Merchant's Guild (next to the entrance to the basement of the Guild)
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_NewRefug: Citizens of the city of Archolos!
As many of you may have noticed, our city has become a refuge for dozens more of Myrtana's citizens who have lost everything due to the war.
In these difficult times, we count on your hospitality and sense of community with our fellow countrymen.

Archolos has always been a capital of culture, prosperity and security - let us together show that it continues to be so. For this reason, we ask all concerned citizens of the city of Archolos to report any deviations from our local laws that our wonderful guests may have committed.
Morris, Governor of the City of Archolos
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Volker_2: There has been a disgusting and shameful attempt of assassination in our city. In broad daylight, on one of the streets, an unknown felon tried to take the life of a respectable citizen, Mr. Volker.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Volker_3: The City Guard is currently examining all the leads and the first suspects have been already detained. According to information provided by Roderich, the investigation is about to end within the following days, so our good people can sleep well again.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Volker_4: If you have any information about this case, you are obliged to bring them to the authorities.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_King_2: We hereby inform you that the ship with the Royal Envoy in the company of an elite unit of the royal guard has reached the shores of Archolos.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_King_3: We inform you, however, it is a routine, yearly visit during which the state of the island shall be assessed, taxes collected and the latest royal decrees communicated.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_King_4: It is mandatory to remember that royal guardsmen are the highest representatives of the crown, and their orders must be unquestionably obeyed!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_WolfsDen: We remind you that the lands of Wolf’s Den in the southeastern part of the island, according to the first peace treaty of Archolos, remain under the control of the members of the royal bloodline of Wolf Sons under the leadership of Ulryk.
In this respect, every person who resides in his domain or attempts to receive a trade permit, not only has to adhere to the Myrtanian law, but also the local rules of Wolf’s Den.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Danger_2: The island of Archolos is truly beautiful and offers many breathtaking sites to see.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Danger_3: But if you do not wish to end your trip quickly, we advise against visiting:
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Danger_4: - Old fortress of Vardhal -  island's northwestern part
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Danger_7: We had reports about missing travellers in these areas. They are considered to be dangerous.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Danger_8: If you want to travel safely, we recommend the service of our runners!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Museum_1: We are proud to announce the opening of a new exhibit at the Archolos City Museum!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Museum_2: If you are interested in history, don't forget to visit us. Our facility is located opposite the Villa of the esteemed Mr. Volker.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_Museum_3: Of course, we also buy all sorts of antique items - especially old coins. Check your pockets and chests, and maybe you'll make some money while enriching our collection for future generations!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_SellIron: Artisan Walter will be purchasing 25 iron nuggets. He will offer full value in gold for each one, whether the vendor delivers the entire order immediately or just individual pieces.
The iron must be delivered to his workshop in the Harbor District, near the shrine of the Water Mages. The easiest way to recognize the workshop is by the Merchant's Guild's runner at the entrance.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_SellOre_: The merchant Dima offers to pay the full value in gold for delivering her powdered magic ore.
Due to an urgent order, she needs up to 100 measures of this magic substance, but she will also accept smaller deliveries.
The goods should be delivered to her stall on the square in front of the Merchant's Guild.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_City_News_SellSilv: Blacksmith Odgar will purchase 50 silver nuggets to complete the latest order.
Nuggets can be donated in smaller deliveries, and there is a gold equivalent for each nugget.
Please note that according to Royal Regulations, materials delivered to the city should not come from Wolf's Den, which includes the Silver Mine there.
The goods should be delivered to Odgar's smithy in the Artisans' District.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Training_P: Are you scared of field raiders? For a few gold coins, Paulus will teach you how to use a heavy branch, sickle or any other one-handed weapon!
Training takes place daily on the square in front of the inn in Silbach.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Training_F: If you like axes and large swords, Folkard will be happy to give you lessons on how to use them.
You can meet Folkard every day at the southern gate of the village.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Training_M: Would you like to hunt scavengers for dinner? Or maybe defend yourself from a wolf on the trail? Markus offers services in dexterity development, archery, obtaining trophies, and crafting ranged weapons.
His tent is located just west of the village's south gate.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Training_K: All budding crossbowmen will be welcome at Kipper, the sentry guarding the north gate. For a small fee, he will show anyone how to use this great weapon more effectively.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Training_S: If you feel that you lack strength, visit the smithy in Silbach! Stone, despite his young age, knows how to build up his strength.
While you're there, don't forget to check out the legendary smithing skills of his master, Thorsten!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_1: List of registered traders in Silbach:
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_2: -Bastian - innkeeper - food, recipes and spirits - village square
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_3: -Thorsten - smith - melee weapons, materials and crafting diagrams - village square
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_4: -Markus - hunter, bowyer - ranged weapons, trophies and crafting diagrams - tent west of the southern gate
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_5: -Lokvar - herbalist - potions, plants and magic scrolls - hut near the cemetery
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_6: -Remy - butcher - meat and meat dishes - house east of the river mill
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_7: -Paola - baker - bread and baked goods - near the village square
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_8: -Carden - hunter - trophies and ammunition - near the east gate
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_Trade_9: The village also has a permit for itinerant trade - traveling merchants often stop near the inn or on main village road.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Frida: Frida from the bowyer's workshop 'On the Trail of the Beast' in the city of Archolos is happy to buy all animal skins, both those of mammals and reptiles.
You will not find such good prices anywhere on the island!
Before you head into the city to sell your trophies, remember that according to current regulations only people with the right papers are allowed through the gates!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_NobMe: The cook Jil, who works at the manor house of our noble Sir Ramsey, is eager to try out all the new dishes, which she could serve for both elegant parties and everyday dinners.
Samples of the proposed dishes should be brought to the kitchen of Silbach Manor.
As per Sir Ramsey's direct order, it is forbidden to bring any food containing ingredients that may permanently affect health!
Nor should larger quantities of the same dish be brought in! However, each first serving will be rewarded handsomely.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_GoldM: The Merchant's Guild Mine invites all interested parties to work in gold mining!
We offer access to our deposits in a private mine between the village of Silbach and the Beekeeper's Camp. After paying a small entrance fee, you will be able to mine gold for as long as you wish!
Regardless of your mining skills, you'll always find something to your liking here!
And when you emerge from the mine, barely carrying all the shiny nuggets, our blacksmith will be happy to exchange them for real gold coins, accepted throughout Myrtana!
Of course, we will also gladly exchange any other nuggets you manage to find anywhere else on our beautiful island.
The easiest way to get to the mine is to use the services of our runners - for a few coins they will bring you there safely!
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Remy_: Due to a sudden large order, butcher Remy will urgently purchase a dozen of the following types of raw meat:
Please note that the meat must be fresh and raw!
All hunters willing to deliver these goods immediately are invited to his slaughterhouse right next to the bridge in the center of Silbach village.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Lokva: The mage Lokvar of Silbach village will accept 10 pieces of blue elder and will pay the full value in gold for each one.
Plants can be brought in one at a time, as the mage is pressed for time. The elder should be delivered to Lokvar's hut next to the cemetery in Silbach.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Watch: Hunters in the service of the benevolent Sir Ramsey warn against wandering alone in the woods surrounding the village!
Especially dangerous according to their reconnaissance were:
-The woods near the waterfalls, east of the village of Silbach - a group of frogmen was spotted there recently.
-The forest to the north of the village - the low light flow there greatly reduces visibility, which creates ideal hunting conditions for wargs.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Beast: Albyn has officially confirmed the disappearance of another farmer!

Despite many clues pointing to a similar attack as in the case of the death of sentry Hendrik, neither the hunters working in the village nor any of the sentries want to admit that this is the work of the beast living in the nearby woods.
All villagers are advised to stay indoors after dark.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Refug: As you have probably noticed yourselves, we are witnessing another wave of refugees seeking refuge in our humble village.

I ask you to treat all our visitors with respect, in accordance with the words of Governor Morris. Remember that they are our countrymen and would do the same for us if it were our island that needed help.
Of course, all refugees are bound by the same rules, so I strongly urge you to report any disturbing behavior by our guests immediately.
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Runes: People of the island of Archolos!
If you happen to find small, bluish grey stones with peculiar markings, bring them as soon as possible to mage Laudus in the city of Archolos!

These stones are called runes of magic and can be used only by qualified mages. People unacquainted with magic will have no use for them, nor will they be able to sell them. Mages of Water, on the other hand, will be more than grateful to receive them from you.
Each citizen who brings them such items will be handsomely rewarded!
Morris, the governor of the City of Archolos
WrittenText_NewsBoard_Silbach_News_Carde: Urgent order for skins and furs!
Due to an urgent large order, hunter Carden will purchase the following skins and furs at close to market price:
Trophies can be delivered one by one and gold will be paid immediately for each one!
Carden can be found during the day on the path behind the eastern gate of Silbach, and during the evening hours he stays at the hunter's camp at the southern gate.
